Reviews.Title: “Welk Resort Tour”
Reviews.Author: imstillconfused
Reviews.Content: We went to the Welk Resort thinking we would be staying in one of the Condos while taking the tour. Upon arrival we were told we would be staying in one of the Hotel rooms, not the condo promised and not with a King size bed as promised. Also not with a jacuzzi tub or fireplace or kitchen as advertised and promised. We were offered a room with 2 queen size beds not King. After some complaining on our part, we were given a King room without a bathtub. No kitchen,just a small refrigerator, no desk or even night stand on the right side of the bed so my wife had to use a chair to hold her sleep machine. The air conditioner made so much noise we could not use it. The small shower needed the shower head replaced. The room number for anyone interested was 112. Now when we went for the tour and voiced our complaints, we were asked to write it down. After doing so, we found out it wasn't good enough to send to corporate, we needed to write it as if we were lied to and not as angry customers. Fact is we were and still are angry because we were lied to as it was a classic bait and switch. We did not get the promised accommodations . Worse the room we were given was dingy and just dirty looking. There was not even any pictures on the walls and strangely the bed did not have a headboard. We did not use any of the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place for a group get-together.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: This was our second year to stay at the Welk Resort Branson for my husband's ship reunion. The first year we couldn't find the place and wandered around looking for it for an hour and a half. (A storm had put out their phones and we couldn't call the hotel for directions.) But both years we have had a beautiful room, a fabulous breakfast buffet taken care of by an attentive wait staff, a nice meeting room and a choice of pools-- the hotel outdoor pool or the Splashatorium with an indoor and an outdoor hot tub. The hotel catered our dinner on the final evening of our stay and the food was wonderful. I think everyone in our group voted to meet again there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest family friendly vacation ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Schneider65644
Reviews.Content: The Welks Branson is a great place for everyone. Whether you and your wife or whole family everyone will enjoy!!!!!!!!! Short 15 minute drive from silver dollar city..music show, golf, go carts, and much much more ! Whether you stay in the hotel or the villa's you have access to water park, put put golf, game room, and much more right on the property. All I can say is try it once and you will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged on Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany C
Reviews.Content: The room did not have any refridgerators or microwaves. This can be difficult when traveling with children. We were supposed to get some special pricing for shows but we only toured the Hollywood Wax Museum. When we got back home, we had been charged for alomst $200.00 extra on my credit card. When I called to question them, they transferred me about 5 times and insisted that they did not charge anything outside of my room and buffet. I faxed copied of the charges to the hotel and never heard back from them although they promised they would have their manager to contact me. Be aware...if you stay, you may be charged for things you did not purchase. I was very disappointed in my stay!!!!! WILL NOT STAY AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “welk resort it the best!!”
Reviews.Author: amber d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the welk resort motel room and It was super clean!! It was updated with the flat screen tv and I loved how the bathroom vanity was in the bathroom!! I give the room 5 stars. The kids loved the little golf course. And the pool area was the BEST. We stayed in the big pool area with the slide almost all day and that night we went to the little pool out back and we had it to ourselves!! we was really suprised with how the big pool area with the indoor slide was not very packed, the kids did not have to wait in line to slide. And a super bonus was we got there early (form silver dollar city) and they said at the desk that we could go play at the big pool until our room was ready and it was not 10 minutes they called with our room ready. The big pool area has large bathrooms with lockers and I loved how the have a family bathroom so when my little girls went to the restroom I did not have to worry about them.I am so ready to visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now, and both times I have been very pleased with the rate, the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the whole facility, and the excellent service for the breakfast buffet. Speaking of breakfast, the buffet is hard to beat. This is not your typical "continental" breakfast where you eat everything out of a disposable container (cereal, yogurt, and the like). This is a huge buffet spread complete with eggs, bacon, sausage, waffle machine, breads, fruits, and lots more. Even though it is buffet style, you'll still be seated by a gracious hostess and served the beverage of your choice at your table. Impressive! The location is great - just a few minutes away from all the activities and shows. The grounds are quite lovely and well-kept, although the lawn did need mowing when we were there. You will enjoy your stay here. If you have younger kids, you will especially enjoy the Splash-a-torium, miniature golf, and other activities for kids. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: avsfan1023
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here on vacation. And the price could not be beat. It was a much better value than most chain places, and was clean and comfortable. The only negative thing was that there was about a half inch crack under the door that allowed a lot of hallway noise into our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with kids...just small kids :-)”
Reviews.Author: ousoonergirl1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Welk Resort. My kids, ages- 4, 9,11 really enjoyed the facilities. They loved the pool with the water slide, putt-putt course, and all the daily activites the resort provides such as, movie night, underwater treasure hunt (some for a fee, i.e., ceramic $2-$5, t-shirt painting $10-$14) craft time and ect. They have a really nice exercise room and game room in the lodge area. My biggest complaint is the rooms. They are extremely small and for the size of our family it was a tight fit. The laundry facilitites were horrible and and 1st floor needed updating. Even with my complaints, we would stay there again because my family did enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hawkerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the first time in June. Great staff, nice room. They also have an outdoor/indoor pool with a water slide and kids area. Showed movies poolside at night. Location is off the strip so you don't have the traffic to deal with and you can get to the strip from a couple different routes so everything is pretty close. Had a problem in the room one night, called the front desk and they had someone there in less than five minutes! Grounds are nice, even had a small miniature golf course the grandkids enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Summer fun.”
Reviews.Author: robinleann
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the pools and also at the theater. It was such an experience. My kids are still talking about it. It is nice to have a place to take your kids somewhere they can have fun and you do not have to worry about them as much.

Reviews.Title: “Room very small”
Reviews.Author: GoHOGSGo1
Reviews.Content: We viewed the pictures online first. Rooms looked nice and spacious. Upon arrival very disappointed in the rooms. They were extremely tight and cramped. However the property is clean and the kids loved the "splashatorium" and mini golf that is on property. It was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ya Gotta Be Strategic!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: This is really a great resort hotel. Why? Well it has a great fitness facility that's professional level to start out. And then it's got that indoor water park which isn't that big but the big slide is just fun as heck for kids and adults. The staff is impressive with their friendliness and courteousness. The only problem I had was one authority heavy lifeguard who thought I came down the slide too fast!!???? Give me a break!!! But now you must shop this place out as rates change dramatically from Spring, to Summer to Fall and Winter. I got a great rate this past Spring and the Fall before it, but when summer hit the same room was 2 and a 1/2 times more money!!!! Wow!!! So keep that in mind as to when you want to go. There's also a major Branson theater on property just out your back door, the Welk Theater, and it has some pretty popular stars perform there, so planning a stay around a performer you may wanna see is a good idea. I'll definitely go back, they've won my business and I've already been there 4 times in the past 2 years. It's a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place”
Reviews.Author: Shannonlisa1
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was updated and nice. My 2 girls had a blast at the splash a torium. They also injoyed the free miniture golf. Everything was close by. The only problem we had was the carpets were not cleaned very good it had chips by edge of bed that didnt belong to us. Also walls are very thin could hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Average lodging with good pool”
Reviews.Author: RanDebbie
Reviews.Content: During recent Branson vacation with grandchildren stayed at the Welk Resort mainly for the waterpark for the kids. Rooms were average. Large pool with a few water park amenities. Did not try restaurant on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: LepFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so our children could "do" the splash - a- torium." They enjoyed it, but after a couple of hours became bored with it. We have stayed at the two other hotels offering an indoor "water park" and they are totally nasty and I will never stay at either of them again! The grounds at this property are beautiful and well kept. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We selected the option of having breakfast included and we enjoyed it very much. The room was clean, but is very small and dated. We are hopeful to go back after they do their rennovation. The "Lodge" section of this property looks very inviting and we would like to try it as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Splash-a-torium was fun, but shouldn't be the deciding factor/”
Reviews.Author: Chuck D
Reviews.Content: I read some other reviews and I have to agree. It is dated, and the rooms were in serious need of a deep cleaning. In all fairness, I did speak with the manager and he said they were renovating "some" rooms - just not ours. The all-you-can-eat breakfast add-on was definitely not worth the money, unless the convenience factor is that valuable to you. It was very average with just the usual suspects, scrambled eggs, limp bacon, sausage and biscuits with gravy (not too bad either). You could make your own waffles and there was plenty of milk, OJ & Apple Juice, plus a nice selection of muffins and sweet breads and sugary cheerios looking things and sugary fruit loop looking things. Now the coffee. Um, how do I explain that? OK, it WASN'T fresh brewed. In fact it wasn't "brewed" at all. I inquired and was told that they bought it in bulk in liquid form. Seriously? I still can't shake that image. OK, the "Splash-a-torium," doesn't that conjure up an image of multiple slides and water attractions? Yup, me too. But no. There is one slide. Admittedly it IS an awesome slide, but there is just the one and it IS indoor so your little ones can play all day without worry of sunburn and there is ample lounging area though it gets HOT in there. Outside there is a kid's play area with little fountains squirting water up out of holes in the ground and a giant bucket that fills and spills every two or three minutes. But, still it isn't what I pictured when I heard the term Splash-a-torium. Next trip to Branson, we'll stay elsewhere - it just wasn't "wunnerful, wunnerful, wunnerful."

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael R
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Welk on our family vacation to Branson and we had a blast! My 3 1/2 year old son loved the splashatorium! He could not get enough of the slide and splash pad! When we arrived e recieved breakfast vouchers for an all you can eat breakfast buffet for our entire stay which was delicious and very cost effective, and also a voucher for a large pizza and drinks to use anytime during our stay! This was one night we did not have to buy dinner which also was a great plus! The rooms are clean and the bed was comfortable. We were very happy with our stay at the Welk Resort and plan to return again! For families with kids this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but would rather stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Statestraveling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great need of a remodel. Walls somewhat dirty with paint chips, some lights on buttons in elevator were burnt out. As example of maintenance not kept up. Outdated. Clean but needs update and items are just worn. Can hear people, doors closing, people walking in floor above. The pool are was nice. However you have to pay more to use it. So if you will be busy in branson, paying for the pool is not worth it. We also added on the breakfast. Too much money, restaurant is dates with 80s. The food was great but not horrible. By the third morning of earring there, we almost went somewhere else for a better and different meal. Even though we had already paid for it. I would not stay here again with all the other options in branson.

Reviews.Title: “Might stay again after the remodel”
Reviews.Author: Krb32
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. Our plan was to be out and about during the day and use the water park in the evenings. We loved it the first day. On the second a storm blew in so it was closing as we were going in. Be aware of this. Even though it's indoors, it's still open to the outside so it will be closed in bad weather. We ended up paying for something we couldn't use and would like to spare other families this cost. Maybe you can pay by the day? The staff was nice, the room was so tiny! We are a family of 4 with a toddler. The room would have been much better if it was a queen with a bunk bed for more space. It would also make sense to have some shelving or cubbies up high where babies can't reach. We were cooped up in that tiny space constantly telling her "no!" and trying to find places to stash things out of her reach. Tiny rooms wouldn't be so bad if they got creative with storage, beds, or something! I'll definitely check again after the remodel if we go back to Branson. The couple hours we had in the water park were great. The grounds are very nice. The location is peaceful. But those rooms! I dread the thought of being stuck in that teeny, dark, uninspired, unusable space again. Just a shelf on the wall! Something! Please!

Reviews.Title: “Blue Hair, Bald Heads and Buicks”
Reviews.Author: bureaucrat377
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I stayed here, we were in our early sixties. We were CHILDREN compared to most of the guests. This is a nice place to stay. It is not really the kind of place I would regularly go, but we got a "deal" we couldn't pass up. It is quiet. The surroundings are nice. We caught Lee Greenwood's show in the theater (part of the deal). We also went to see the Pierce Arrow show. One of the principal reasons for the trip was to go to the cemetary in Protem, which is near by. The scenery in the area is beautiful. The drive up from East Texas was enjoyable. We had a plesant stay. 'Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mcjrg1994
Reviews.Content: My sister had stayed at the lodges and said they were beautiful, and they are. However, we stayed in a King Room with a sofa sleeper. They had done a "facelift" rehab of the room - new bedding and curtains. The carpet was not very nice and the bathroom was in dire need of rehabbing. The waterpark was very nice. We spent at least three hours there every day with the kids. They loved the waterslide! When I made our reservations online, we chose the room, breakfast and waterpark option. However, at checkout, they charged us another $15.xx per day for two kids for breakfast, which added almost another $100 to our bill. I told them in our reservation that there were four of us. I was extremely upset with this. If we were to stay there again, I would save up to stay in a lodge room, not the hotel and you can get a nicer breakfast for less than $30 a day for four!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: pdier
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days here for a family vacation/daughter's dance national competition. The only thing negative I could say was that the 2 queen bed room is small. It was a challenge to find room for all of our stuff, but once we got settled in, we made do. We spent a lot of time at the pool. The "Splashatorium" was a great place to hang out. The pool was well-maintained, well-staffed, and they had lots of activities to keep my 11 year-old child occupied. The grounds were very clean. They were well-maintained. I highly recommend getting the breakfast buffet add-on if you stay here. The breakfast buffet is very good. the staff at the Stage Door restaurant was very friendly and personable. I can't say enough about the staff at the hotel. They were consistently great. My daughter celebrated her 12th birthday the last day we were there. While we were at the pool, my wife had the staff decorated our room. The look on my daughter's face when she opened the door was priceless. They went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: Holly R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for almost a week and had a fabulous time! Although it was crowded the pool was big enough that it didn't matter. My kids and i both loved the water slide and we saved a bit playing the put put golf course on the grounds. Rooms were clean and updated. Concierge was nice and very helpful. Will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for a 3 night stay arriving 8/5/2012. Based on the reviews, I requested an upgraded room with double queen,splashpark,breakfast,and more.They told me no problem.When I received my confirmation there was nothing about an upgraded room. I called again only to find out they cant guarantee an upgraded room. After getting my 6 year old so excited about her hotel for our vacation, I have to tell her I cant drive 4 hours and spend 400.00 on the CHANCE we get a nice room. How fliping hard is it to confirm an upgraded room two weeks in advance??????

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: Mendy M
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The bathroom vanity was covered in hair, urine stains and hair surrounded the toilet, hair in the bathtub, plus had a hair on the decorative bed pillow. The "clean" towels were not so clean. Multiple towels had visible makeup on them and found hair on a towel. The bottom of the bathtub was not clean. Also stains on the sheets and a piece of paper near the tv that had a young child's writing on it. I have no idea how this was overlooked. I was there with my husbands family so I was polite and did not complain but it was disgustingly dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great Pool area, Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 days, and kids loved it! we spent majority the time at the pool. I love the later pool hours, not everyone that goes to Branson wants to see a Jubilee or Jamboree!!! The staff was very helpful in booking reservations and the box office ladies were great with helping us book tickets for the Price is Right show. Rooms were on the small side, but clean. plenty of fresh clean towels! The pool area had activites for the kids thourgh out the whole day, tshirt painting, arts and crafts etc. Fri night they had a bbq pool side, we ate there, portions were small but it was cheaper than dining out. Later that night they did bingo, and a movie outside next to the pool. Over all we had a great experince! If i were to go back to Branson, this would prob be the only reason to, Not into all the shows and hype! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bellesmom08
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Welk Resort in Branson! I booked at the last minute and was a little worried when I read some of the reviews on here, but couldn't have been more pleased. We booked a package thru the hotel that included tickets to the Dixie Stampede and Silver Dollar City. The kids really enjoyed the Splashatarium and arcade that was on the property and begged to stay an extra day so they could use it some more. There were daily activities to keep them busy if needed. The property was well maintained, safe, and well-lit at night. All the staff was friendly, gracious, and knowledgable. The buffet breakfast was delicious and offered lots of great food. The hotel is about 3 miles from the strip, but we weren't complaining. The drive to the stip was nice and it was so peaceful where we were. The only thing I noticed not "perfect" was that the hotel rooms were a little dated...but that's nothing that a little paint and minor remodeling couldn't fix. Oh! And the beds were HEAVEN. I never sleep well at hotels, but slept like a log every night I was there. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Janet S
Reviews.Content: The Welk Resort has a lot of extra amenities for kids - swimming pools, playground, putt putt golf, a game room, the Splash-a-tor-ium where they also have games and activities on a daily basis, and hot tubs. It was a great place to stay with a family. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you the voucher we had for the room said check in was 3:00 p.m. but they had changed the check in time to 4:00 p.m. but our room was not ready at 4:00 pm. The pool/Splashatorium is not inside the hotel it is across from it. I don't think the front desk cares about anything because they are so booked up, they don't have to care. The pool was neat but the rooms were so small we didn't have enough room. As with any place you stay there were TONS of unruly kids. I have 2 children who are very well behaved and it was just crazy with kids and not to be mean but elderly people too. It just wasn't relaxing, kind of stressful. Room service closes at 9:00 pm. We had to order Pizza and pay $40 for 2 pizza's from Domino's one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jhaleyusa
Reviews.Content: Property is very clean and the staff is very friendly. We did not stay in the main resort room area, we asked for a upgrade and stayed in the "owners lodge" area just up the hill. Our lodge room was awsome. Kitchen had all appliances. Washer,dryer, fridge,disposal,stove,oven, microwave, blender, toaster, coffee maker, etc. Living room and dining area are all together and had a queen size fold out bed in the couch, large flat screen tv above the fireplace, dinner table for 6 and extra chairs. Living room and master bedroom open up to a large porch area, with patio table/chairs and 2 rocking wood chairs to relax in. The outdoor celing fans made for a nice breeze during the evenings. Master bedroom was huge with king bed, tow sided fireplace, ironing board, room safe, large closet, large chest and night stand storage. The bathroom is huge as well with double sink area, another storage closet area, 4 person walk in shower, and closed off toilet area. The airconditioning worked perfect and was able to keep our room at 74 all day. The rooms all had very good room darking curtians that worked ! The kids pool has many water features and should not be missed. Pool closes at 10pm and begins quite time. We found that all the guests here were very respectful of others and from 10pm to about 8am you would not here a peep from anyone. The Welk is only 5 min from all the strip action, but far enough away to enjoy a quite relaxing vacation. This is a property that we will stay in again the next time we visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Fuji85
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay! The grounds are very nice and the people are extremely friendly. We ordered room service it was fast and hot. We hated to leave and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer198
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights but thankfully we were able to check out after first night. 2 queen rooms were very small and bed even seemed smaller than a queen! Did not seem clean and very noisy with paper thin walls. Definitely would not recommend. The new waterpark was very nice and it's a shame the hotel could not be of the same standard. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet, but all in all -- not impressed with this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: barbeq
Reviews.Content: After staying here twice, I HAD to stay here again for our yearly Branson experience. The rooms are nice with a GREAT waterpark - the best in Branson. The pool is quite large with an outdoor and connecting indoor pool. The jaccuzi is great, in fat, one outdoors and one indoors. There is a restaurnant onsite that offers a great breakfast to start the day with a large choice of foods. I like how the hotel offers family-oriented fun at the pool, even had a blow-up screen with the movie Rio playing poolside. Pool offers drinks in the evening and food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family get together. I thought it had a great location. About 5 minutes from the main strip. Was a very family oriented place. Fun water park for the kids. Free play station and movies. Decent free mini golf. Had things for kids to do every night pool side. Rooms were quiet but a bit small and dated. Missed having a frig. Overall, very happy and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Branson ever”
Reviews.Author: Arguell H
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for a couple of nights, and i found them on the internet.We stayed the weekend of the 4th of July, the property was very clean and all the staff very heplful. The in door waterpark was a big hit with us and all of the activities were awesome. I will have no problem staying here on our future trips. Wish thery would include breakfast buffet in the room price though.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: Dan W
Reviews.Content: Found on internet was looking for place to stay for long weekend with a nice pool for the kids price was right booked it and glad i did very nice indoor outdoor water park nighty activities for the kids and adults alike with nightly happy hours and friendly staff also had a great breakfast buffet great familt value

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: FrauMorgan
Reviews.Content: Our 3 daughters and families met here for a long weekend. Our grandson Davis (8) summed it up,"best trip ever". The Resort is in a great location by Table Rock but not far from the strip. Although we went to a few shows and other activities, the resort made the weekend great. Good food, plenty to do on site or within walking distance, but the best was the staff who bent over backwards to accommodate us when they were 100% booked. Room service and Poolside service were fast and when I needed to ice my foot, they offered their refrigerator for my gel pack. We would have liked to have had refrigerators in our room, but understand that a dance group was there several days before our arrival and they got them first. The concierge was always friendly and helpful. While not a fancy hotel, the friendliness of the staff made it an excellent place for our family of 8 adults and 6 children 2-10 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Pool is the only saving grace.”
Reviews.Author: WishyaKnew
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a little family vacation in Branson and spent 3 nights at the Welk Resort in Branson, Mo. Our room was on the 3rd floor, room 315. Noticed they were doing lots of construction right in the hall next to our door but since we were gone all day long they did not bother us. Then on second day the painting started and the fumes were overwhelming! I saw that everyone was leaving the 3rd floor hall we were on and I asked for a different room. (This was during a slow weekday... not a weekend) I was given a foul look by the desk clerk and told she would see what she could do. It was 3 hours before we got a new room...a MUCH smaller room on the second floor. We were not offered a refund or even an apology. The only saving grace for this hotel is the water park/slide/pool area which my kids loved. But there was a worker yelling at people's kids that they weren't allowed to go down the slide on their stomachs...even though there was no sign. I noticed she yelled at some kids that did it, and not at others that did it. There was nothing special about this hotel except for the slide/pool area. Rather disappointing for the price we paid to stay here. The food served here was highly over priced so we did not order and for what we paid to stay here there should have at least been a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: I_lv2travel12
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, no issues, rooms are clean. The hotel is a little dated, but going through a renovation. Flat screen TV's with no high definition content. Internet is good, no issues. Breakfast, be sure and get voucher at hotel front desk, saves $3. After cocktails in lounge, great price. Keys are not electronic, they are hard keys, this needs updating. Have not been to a hotel in the last 5 years where the keys were not electronic. (Mag card swipe or RFID). Staff is friendly, no lobby furniture. A single PC in lobby, no printer. A good place for Branson, they classify "resort" different than they do in say Vegas. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures and reviews do this place no justice!”
Reviews.Author: islandgrown83
Reviews.Content: My family and I are hard core Orlando junkies. We like to stay at nice resorts down there so our expectations are very high. My other half being from Missouri insisted we try Branson. I was very reluctant because I didn't see anything there that I though could satisfy my summer resort needs. I was WRONG. I gave the Welk a try and I was NOT disappointed. There is something there for everyone and its really fun for the whole family no matter what age your kids are. The onsite restaurant has an excellent breakfast I might add. The indoor pool area is awesome and that water slide will keep your little ones busy for hours if not days. There is a play area for your really young kids. The best part is the hot tubs are situated so that your kids can play and you can see them. There is nightly activities for kids such as games and movies. This resort is a much better resort then the Grand Country Inn in my opinion. The Grand Country Inn is good if you have real small children only (2-5 years old). The Welk is good for all ages including parents. Another benefit is its away from the busy strip and in a quite area. I wasn't bothered with timeshare tours. Probably because I booked with Expedia. But I did notice that some of the other guest were bothered with it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, fun pool”
Reviews.Author: leah k
Reviews.Content: We just got a hotel room on hotels.com (didn't do a 'tour') and it was very nice ! The slide is fun even for adults, pool is nice and big. Room was very clean, bed was comfy and they have nice towels :) Easily accessible to Branson shopping and eating - would love to return again ! The staff also let us check out a few hrs late so we could swim longer (no charge) - that was very nice !

Reviews.Title: “Dont take the time share tour no matter how good the perks.”
Reviews.Author: spyle31
Reviews.Content: Room and facility top notch. Time share sales people are all nicey nicey until you tell them there 90 minutes are up and its time to leave. Unbelievable at the change in attitude when we would not stay longer to let them finish the sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Nasty and more!”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet....The room was disgusting!! The bathroom had "hair" all over the vanity and it also had some dried brown junk on it which I could only guess what that was. Did I mention that my husband and I are both sick after leaving the hotel? I won't even go into how a maint worker tried to come into our room unannounced...uh hello you scared my kids and your lucky the top door latch was on because it would have been ugly...real ugly....Castle Law!?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dapakade321
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 kids and I stayed for 4 nights in late May at the Welk Resort. We had a great time! We had a basic room with 2 Queens which was all we needed...so much to do in Branson...the hotel room is really just for sleeping. Our room package included breakfasts and entrance in the Splashatorium. I recommend this! The kids loved swimming in the Splashatorium. (They also enjoyed the free mini golf course that they could play anytime at the resort.) And the buffet breakfast was very good! I also liked that the Welk Resort was off the main strip...it is located between the main Branson strip and Table Rock Lake...perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShellyMaranaAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over the Memorial Weekend and had a great time. The front desk staff said the resort was sold out for the weekend, but you couldn't tell. We purchased one of the packages which I would highly suggest. It was a great deal for what we did. The breakfast buffet was really good. It had pretty much anything you would ever want for breakfast and everything was fresh. We did not get a chance to use the pool area, but it looked like all the kids were having a blast. We stayed in the main hotel and the rooms were an average hotel room. Nothing special. We just used it to sleep in which worked out fine for us. The only downfall I had with the room, was the inside of the toilet was not cleaned when we first got to the room. I noticed a cleaning lady down the hall, informed her of it and she had someone immediately come by and take care of it. Other than that everything was very clean. Also, there is only one main restaurant on site. So if you just wanted to get a quick bite to eat or a little snack, you are pretty much stuff with the vending machines. The hotel is in a great location, just enough off the strip to get away from the busy traffic, but close enough to all the shows and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Can Not Wait to Come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Angel S
Reviews.Content: Everything about our trip here was perfect! We will be back!! thanks so much to all the friendly people and for all the help with our package. You helped make out trip perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great Branson Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay and close to the action. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Price was a bargin for our 5 night stay. The next time we would not eat all our breakfasts at the hotel. It was O.K., but a change would have been nice. We really liked the no smoking and no pet policy.

Reviews.Title: “WELL DONE!”
Reviews.Author: saguarol
Reviews.Content: Welk Resort Branson does it right! We stayed here a week and every employee we encountered was polite, pleasant, and professional. Upon arrival there was a small issue with our room. Ten minutes later~problem solved. We got to meet April our reservation rep who actually works right on site, not off shore. Before arrival she booked our room, breakfast tickets, the Splashatorium (pool and slide attraction) and our shows.She has the ability to get the best seats in the house. Everything was awaiting our arrival and so organized. We found our room clean, well appointed and welcoming. That is due to smiling Dianne's attention to detail in our room. The 4th floor was very quiet and overlooked the American flag on the lawn. Lovely sight first thing in the morning and last thing at night. Concierge Veronica helped us map out our routes to get to and from our destinations easily. She had some great suggestions on restaurants too. Jackie, Shawna and Ryan in the Stagedoor on premise restaurant did a great job. Don't miss the highly entertaining Clay Cooper show. He talks to audience members and actually remembers their names throughout the performance. His wife Tina and her abilities are in a class all by themselves. She did a solo dance that was etherial. Be sure to book the incredible Marty Robbins Tribute lead by Leroy New on an 8" high intimate stage with two other performers. No glitsy lights, gimmicks or pomp and circumstance. Just incredible ability by the performers in a quiet setting that leaves you wanting more. Thankfully, love of God and country is alive and well in Branson. Going to Branson and choosing the Welk Resort made for happy pages in our memory book. Go, you won't be disappointed. Every genre available for all of our variant tastes.

Reviews.Title: “The welk resort in Branson is fairli convenient”
Reviews.Author: Txbec64
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews and they were not correct, the Welk Resort, this is a family resort with things for kids as well as adults. The few downsides are: the lighting in the room and no tub in the room we stayed in. Everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tina T
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the resort. The grounds were beautiful and very peaceful, my children loved the pool area and we love the mini golf. Staff were wonderful and very helpful in any questions we had. The breakfast bar was the best we have ever been to. Not only will we go back but we will deffinately tell everyone about Welk Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mopesty
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Welk resort and we chose it because we were taking our 5 year old grand daughter to Branson. The room was huge, not like any other I've stayed in before. Had room to build her a "castle" on one side and not even interfere with walking around. Large area around the sink/microwave/coffee area. A full length mirror on the wall she could dance in front of! The splashatorium is great if you have children along. Two hot tubs allowed us to be in one and still watch her in the swimming pool. We had not thought to take pool toys and they have them for sale at reasonable price. We paid $4 for a swim ring. This is the perfect place to take a break with children because they can enjoy the swimming in down time from seeing shows.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area Nice room Pleasant personnel Great waterpark”
Reviews.Author: moonstone0005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welk Resort in Branson Missouri in late April 2012. The room was pretty standard. The people at the front desk were pleasant. The water park, a "Splashatorium" was a lot of fun. We went to the water park when it opened at 10 am. There was no one there but the attendant, who was very nice. She turned on the waterslide and showed us both the indoor and outdoor hot tubs. The indoor pool is warm and very pleasant to float in. My husband who is 65 years old went down the waterslide several times and really enjoyed it. Just a nice morning at the pool. There were lots of seats around the pool. There were plenty of towels to dry off with, and nice rooms to change into our swimming suits. The outdoor pool was not open yet. The pool started getting several people about noon. There was also a miniature golf course available on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in the middle of a hectic move with our 3-year-old. The staff was very friendly, the hotel clean and inviting and we had plenty of options for us to have a relaxing evening in. We slept soundly and woke up to a great breakfast buffet. It was far from usual cookie cutter hotel box breakfast. There were endless options made from scratch, hot and ready to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Family”
Reviews.Author: tomandcynthia
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grandsons and I stayed at this resort over spring break. Be aware . . . we had a two-queen-bed-room and it was VERY small -- definitely smaller than your normal two-bed-hotel-room. Only enough room to walk around the beds. It was too crowded for two adults and two children -- the extra money for a lodge room is definitely worth spending if you are staying more than one night. The room was clean. We did have room service one night and the staff was great with the food being excellent. Breakfast buffet was huge and good. The splash-a-torium was a huge hit with the kids even though it was very crowded over spring break. Front desk service was actually very slow. I am not sure if this is normal for this location but they definitely need more front desk people -- it took an average of 10 minutes per check-in and they only had two, sometimes three people working the front desk. So if it's crowded, be prepared to stand for a LONG time. The location was great -- close to everything. Overall, would definitely try this place again, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Welk Resort and Splashatorium”
Reviews.Author: Jan C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and granddaughter and I stayed at Welk Resort over spring break and had a wonderful stay; the staff were friendly & helpful; the splasharium was an instant hit with Hailey; the resort was clean and beautiful! Will definitely stay there again. Jan Coover

Reviews.Title: “Family Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: Kristy T
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly. It rained most of the time we're there but we had so much fun sight seeing and staying busy. The only thing I didn't like was the waterpark. Well we tried go in the evening and it was full, couldnt get in the pool. Tried to go in kiddie pool with daughter but there was a lot of adults in there. We didn't get to swim. We did use the game room, we had fun. Not a lot of games but who's there to play games when there's so much to do and see. I loved eating in the caferteria for breakfast, the buffet was so good. Who could think about being on a diet with this delious food! It was nice to come back to the room at the end of the day and the room to have your room cleanded and to have clean towels. We had a memorable stay. We also enjoyed shopping in the gift shop. We hated to leave, we plan to come back in July!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welk stay”
Reviews.Author: Anita S
Reviews.Content: We knew we wanted to go to Branson for a mini-vacation during spring break and was looking for a place that was off the strip. The Welk was just what we were looking for plus the indoor water park and spa was just what the doctor ordered after a long day of shopping. The staff were very sweet and the food in the on location restaraunt was just divine and the price was comparable to the other places in town. They even have a mini-golf course onsite as well. I would highly recommend staying here as it has just about everything a guest could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: SanditeMom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from spending part of our Spring Break in Branson. When I was making the arrangements, my kids specified a place with an indoor water park. My Google search turned up the Welk Resort. I was familiar with the resort, but had never stayed there. I got what I thought was a great deal price wise and made our reservations. I was initially pleased with the front desk staff and found our room clean and everything in working order. The beds were comfy and we had plenty of room. My kids, 17 and 10, LOVED the water park! My husband and I LOVED the hot tub! I liked that it was open late so that we could use it after getting back from dinner and shows. They also used the game room and liked it as well. The short drive into Branson wasn't bad and I enjoyed being away from the "Strip" and the traffic. In return for attending a sales presentation on the time shares offered, we were able to get SDC tickets for $30 each! I was thrilled by this as it saved me over $100. The presentation lasted a little longer than we had been told, but it ended up not being an issue. We did not purchase a vacation package and this visably disappointed our sales rep. He was never rude, but once we said no, his demeanor changed and the friendly, personalble guy he had been, was ready for us to leave. This did not spoil my opinion of the resort and we will likely stay there again. I would recommend this for families and we look forward to coming back in the summer months so we can take full advantage of the pool area and other outdoor activities offered!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break stay at Welk Resort in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: DinahFFriendship_TN
Reviews.Content: For the second of two spring breaks in a row, we have just returned from the Welk Resort in Branson, MO. We chose to stay there the first year just because of the indoor swim/slide "Splash-a-torium" and my 10 year old was not disappointed! She really loved everything about it , including all the other kids to play with. The rooms were nice and clean and the beds were extra comfortable. The staff was very helpful and attentive. We ate breakfast each day at the Stage door Restaurant which was delicious and a great time saver. We also had a pizza dinner one night that came with our "Silver Dollar City" package that was freshly made and delicious! The staff had our Dixie Stampede tickets and Silver Dollar City tickets available when needed. I am sure that when we visit Branson again, we will stay at the Welk Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal if you use the Splash-A-Torium”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: The in-door / out-door pool is very nice and worth the price of the stay. There is one slide that the kids (and adults) seem to enjoy. The 2 hot tubs are very large and relaxing. They provide pool towels that are heated...yes, heated! That is awesome. We had 2 children with us. The only issue I had with the pool is the lack of a shallow area for my youngest to play. The depth of the pool goes from 3'6" - 5'. The 2 hot tubs are at a depth of 3'6". They have an area outside for the kids to run around and splash, but there's no "kiddie pool" area. The rooms are just average hotel rooms. The pillows are horribly small and lumpy - my neck hurts as I'm writing this. The heater/ac unit was very loud and would turn on and off every 5 minutes. So I would just get to sleep and it would kick on and wake me up. After the first night I got used to it. But between the pillows and the a/c unit, didn't sleep much the first night. If you're planning on staying to enjoy the pool, the Welk is worth it. Otherwise go find something else.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, you can't complain.”
Reviews.Author: LingCoMo
Reviews.Content: No minifridge or microwave in rooms. No free breakfast. A/C is noisy. But for the price, we can't really complain. Carpet is dirty, toilet flushes slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: SMMCW
Reviews.Content: We live in Joplin, Mo, and wanted a little Get Away, this was perfect!! Prices were awesome for what was included. I paid $55 tax included. Only thing missing was the continental breakfast, but we survived. My boy had such fun in the Splash A Torium, also had fun playing pool, air hockey, and mini golf. Being we took our get away in January there was not much to do in Branson, so we spent most of our time playing at the hotel. I would definitely stay at the Welk again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Anita E
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond what was expect. I would highly recommend Welk Resort.

Reviews.Title: “SPLASH-A-TORIUM--Great place on a winter day.”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at a place that our boys (3 and 6) could have some fun on a winter day. The splash-a-torium was the perfect place. It was a big enough area for the kids to play, but not so big that I couldn't let the kids go to the top of the slide by themselves. It was easy to supervise both boys at the same time. The room was nice and clean, the grounds, including the playground and mini golf area was tidy, and the buffet breakfast was a nice way to start the day. Overall, it was a pleasant stay that I would recommend to a friend and I would return myself. My only compaint would be that there were not showers at the splash-a-torium, but the rooms were just a short walk away so it was not a huge inconvienience.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied in Branson”
Reviews.Author: bozo140
Reviews.Content: Room was small - at time of booking we were told we would have adjoining rooms with other family members.When we checked in they told us that could not be.We had to go out in the cold and walk to the pool and hot tub.My grand daughter had a pair of boots in the room that she did not wear during our stay but when we got home realized we did not have them.I called the resort and received an answering machine for Housekeeping - after 3 days they returned my call on a Sunday afternoon and said they had the boots.I asked where they were found and was told she did not know - they just showed up on her desk!She wanted my credit card number for shipping - after 4 days they arrived.I checked my statement and was charged $19.35 - I feel that this should have been a courtesy of the resort.I have a feeling that the cleaning lady took them and brought them back after I called the resort about them.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but well worth the extra couple miles!”
Reviews.Author: grandma3x
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that was relaxing, friendly and had amenities that included things to do when we weren't out touring Branson. This hotel had it all! There were things for the grandkids as well as the adult kids! Everyone enjoyed the Splash a torium and mini golf! Thanks for such a great time! This hotel helped us make a great memory!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Nedra T
Reviews.Content: Welk Resort was a nice getaway for Thanksgiving for my family of 4. The rooms were nice, with soft, comfy beds. The shower was the BEST!! The indoor waterpark is fun for young kids and we loved the game room and mini golf. We didn't go to any of the shows but got a package deal for Shepherd of the Hills and Silver Dollar City. The package was reasonably priced and we got a discount on the Thanksgiving meal and 2 free mornings of the breakfast buffet. The breakfast was great but the Thanksgiving meal seemed like everything came out of a can. Get your dinners somewhere else. The staff was nice and helpful and the resort was very clean and kept up. Nice place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Welk Resort Branson Mo Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Josephine D
Reviews.Content: I thought the people were very friendly and helpful. You have everything you need there: pool, restaurant, exercise, theater, gift shop. It is located minutes from all other attractions. Very clean rooms and towels were nice and soft and they had alot of them in room for your use.

Reviews.Title: “Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: My sister always watched the Welk show with our Mom when growing up and fell in love with the Stars. It was a dream of hers to come to Branson and stay at the resort and attend the live shows. We stayed 3 nights and slept on the most comfortable beds ever! It was very easy to book hotel room and shows. We easily upgraded 2 shows. Christmas joy and decor was all over town and added to our experience. Everyone was so friendly and the true meaning of Christmas was shared openly. We have decided to make this a yearly Christmas event.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Springfield_MOLjj
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Welk Resort Hotel on Nov. 3 and had a very nice stay. The Hotel staff was friendly and knowledgable. The room was clean and comfortable. We were happily surprized when we were told that the traveling Vietnam wall was onsite and ceremony would be held the next morning. It was a very moving ceremony and we appreciate the involvement of the Welk Hotel to present this yearly. We attended a showing of the full resort. Steve P. was very friendly, knowledgable of their program and the multitude of offerings with Welk Resorts. We ate at the Stage Door restaurant-friendly courteous service. Food was good. The splashatorium is a good place for young families with children. I think teens would enjoy it as well. My husband and I have worked in the Hotel/Hospitality industry for more than 30 years. We are tough critics and Welk Resort in Branson passed with flying colors. The Welk Resort in Branson is truly a vacation destination. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “" Customer service at its best"”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this resort in the last 6 months. I am so glad I checked Trip Advisor reviews when I decided to book our first stay with our 8 year old granddaughter. Welks Resort is a great place to stay for children and adults. Very clean, and a staff that is always willing to go out of their way to meet their guests needs. In Nov. my husband and I stayed at Welk again, and enjoyed it as much as we did our first time. Both times we took advantage of their all inclusive packages. It includes your stay, breakfast buffet, a show of your choice for every night you stay at the resort, and even a welcome basket in your room. Welks rezervation staff are just as good as the other employees you come face to face during your stay. I could go on and on..... Overall wonderful place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: We vacation in Branson alot and have stayed at many motels/hotels. I purchased a Groupon for a 2 night stay and tickets to see Lee Greenwood. What a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights and enjoyed it very much. I thought it was very clean. We enjoyed the show which was a short walk to theater from our room. Never had to wait for elevator. Had all our questions answered promptly. The beds were firm and very comfortable for us. Had a beautiful view from our room. Staff was courteous and very friendly. The room was quiet and we slept well. I liked being away from the traffic and rush of Branson. Would consider going there again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: Used a Groupon for a 2 night stay + show - without this we could not have afforded their regular prices. This is a nice place, great for families. The mini golf was fun, the game room has foosball, air hockey, and pool. The Splashatorium looks like great fun for kids, and there is a little playground. For the price, breakfast should be included. We happen to have fond memories of the Lawrence Welk show, and were disappointed that he isn't featured that much anywhere except the lobby of the theatre. We were very surprised and disappointed that they weren't at least playing champagne music in the lobbies and gift shop. The room was clean and the staff were very pleasant and accommodating...however, if they want to charge five star prices, they are going to need to update. Altogether a pleasant stay in a nice surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “Billy”
Reviews.Author: billlipp
Reviews.Content: Answered a Groupon ad and enjoyed our stay at the Welk Resort. The room was average but clean and the value was great...2 nights and the Lee Greenwood / Louise Mandrell show was walking distance from our room and quite entertaining for a reasonable price. They have a beautiful workout/pool area that we didn't use but came with the room. Would not stay here again without a coupon of some sort or free breakfast. Most hotels in Branson have free breakfast. Short drive to Table Rock Dam.

Reviews.Title: “One stinky room”
Reviews.Author: Randy M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to celebrating our 35th wedding anniversay in Branson. We made reservations for a wheelchair accessible room. Upon checking in our room had a horrible stink. When we reported it to the staff the clerk on duty told us that the room had been cleaned but they would do it again while we went to out first show. Upon returning to the room, no change. It is now 10 PM. Reporting it again we were told there were no other rooms available. We said we would like to check out and were told that was fine but good luck trying to find a room in Branson. We did find one at midnight at the Grand Oaks. The staff at the Grand Oaks went out of their way to accomadate us. They saved our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: a very nice resort, clean, nice staff, very good breakfast, has pool, splash area, and two hot tubs. The room was a little small, but ok. Resort is about three miles from main town of branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: roarinkc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights this past week while on a honeymoon with my new wife. Location was very easy to find and in the quite part of town. Check in was a breeze and the room was very comfortable and clean. Only minor issue we had is that the first day we were there the sink in the bathroom drained very slowly. After contacting the front desk to make them aware of the issue the problem was resolved by the next morning. When reserving or checking in make sure to get the breakfast passes because it will be one last thing to worry about especially if you don't want to fuss around with finding a good breakfast place. Breakfast overall was very average for buffet standards but hit the spot regardless. I would stay here again and recommend this to anyone staying in the Branson Mo, area.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: beth r
Reviews.Content: we had a really nice time. my husband and kids loved the resort - and we had fun swimming in the heated pools. the employees were super friendly- very helpful with anything we needed. the breakfast buffet was great - kept very clean and lots of choices. i was pleasantly suprised the resort was a bit off the beaten path, away from the hustle and bustle. my husband was thrilled we were so close to the water where he took our 2 boys (age 4 and 6) trout fishing ! the scenery was beautiful, so was the resort. our boys also loved the putt putt coarse right outside our back door. sooo much fun - and everyone was sooo nice. will definately be returning. i recommend the "duck tour" while in town - quack quack, cool ! there's a small playground area and lots of woods for exploring. really great for little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BeachWoman10
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 3 nights at the Welk and were impressed. It is very clean and is a good place for families with children. They treated us like royalty and there are restaurant, theatre and games on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BV36
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay for a reunion at the Welk Branson Resort. The staff were very helpful. Ron the Houseman really went out of his way to make sure we had what we needed in the hospitality room, and was quick about it. He has a wonderful personality and kept checking if we needed anything. The resteraunt staff especially the Manager, Doug was friendly and made sure our private buffet was perfect. The food was delicious and the servers were very professional. Cherie, Sales Manager, was easy to work with when making our reservations. She made sure we had what we needed, and met us at the resort upon check in. She always answered my emails in a timely manner. The price for the package was the exceptional. The rooms have been upgraded since our last visit. The TV's are flat screen, the beds are comfortable, and clean. The house keeper was friendly. We enjoyed the show at the resort. To have a resteraunt and theater on site is so beneficial to those who do not like to drive after dark. The staff in the gift shop make you feel welcome when you enter the shop. We are already looking forward to next years reunion at the Welk Branson Resort. What can I say, we love this resort. If you are looking for a package deal we do not believe it gets better than this. Veterinary Class of 1958

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get away for the weekend with our six year old daughter. A friend work told me of the Welks resort and I am so glad that she did. We had a great time in the pool and the water slide was awesome. The mini golf was better during the day, they advertise open till 10pm but its WAY to dark at night. The food was better than average but a little expensive. I cant say enough good things about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Holly S
Reviews.Content: the place was very clean and everyone was nice. we'll go back again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Vacation”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth visit to Branson and stay at the Welk Resort. It was the best of all. Vacation Specialist Stacy took our desires for 5 shows in 3 days and arranged them perfectly with very good seats. The room was neat, clean and very comfortable. Hot buffet breakfasts at the Stage Door Restaurant were very good. The hotel staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: leon m
Reviews.Content: After a great 4 day USMC Viet Nam squadron reunion,I became ill on my last night.I called the desk,told them of my problem and needed blankets, within a very few minutes the security guard was at my door with all the blankets I needed.He personality came into my room and wraped them around me. Later that afternoon I needed something to eat,but was told the kitchen closed between 2-4 pm for cleaning,after explaining my problem,food was delivered. I can't say enough about their great service. I would be back for sure Leon Moore Montgomery,Al.

Reviews.Title: “HMM-162 Reunion 2011”
Reviews.Author: HMM_162
Reviews.Content: We are members of a Marine Corps Helicopter Squadron that served in Vietnam in 1964-1965. We meet every 2 years in different locations. This year we chose the Welk Resort Branson. From the first time we visited it till the end of the reunion, we all agree that the experience was one of our best reunions ever. The service on all levels was superior, starting with the resort group planning office though all phases of our experience we were given outstanding service and assistance. The restaurant was great and the theater show (Lee Greenwood) was top shelf. The hotel staff was the most helpful group of people. The level of service was first class. We would recommend this resort for any military group planning a reunion. They cater to the military reunion experience and are experts in all levels of the planning though the execution of the reunion. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Branson”
Reviews.Author: B0bbie51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welk Resort in Branson, Mo. It was a very wonderful, pleasant, place to stay. They have an indoor water park for families, we didn't use it since my 2 sisters and I wasn't interested in it. But children I talked to thought that it was awesome. They had a wonderful buffet for breakfast, hot dishes, for a very low price. Wonderful workout room, nice pool. plus lots of other things. They help us out booking shows, and helped lanning our days. would recommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “the water park makes the value”
Reviews.Author: Bullfrog4d
Reviews.Content: We came once before with our kids but spent 3 nights just the wife and i. Had a blast at pools, slide and hot tubs. Highly recommend however away from the strip. Close to table rock lake damn. Rooms are good though not what Im spoiled with at holiday inn. No mini fridge and free hot breakfast but atbargain rates who can complain.

Reviews.Title: “very nice facility, not so nice customer service”
Reviews.Author: retired0954
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into this resort through Interval International, using a Marriott one-bedroom timeshare exchange. We had a one-bedroom, one-bathroom timeshare with a washer-dryer and full kitchen. It was very clean and very comfortable, with a jetted tub, wrap around shower, two fireplaces, and a large deck overlooking a little pond with a water wheel. The unit was great and very comfortable, although the living/dining area seemed small because of HUGE furniture which made it difficult to get around. The unit would not easily have accommodated more than the two of us. I would not have wanted to be in this unit with children. The pool did not open until 10 am so we could not do our morning water exercises (which we do early). We were never given a schedule of activities at this resort, and we did not observe any going on. To the best of our knowledge, there were NO activities planned at the resort. The customer service at check-in and concierge was not great. People did not smile, they were kind of mean, actually. We booked our shows at the Jubilee grocery store rather than with the Welk people - the staff at Welk were just not nice enough to make us want to book through them. We did not see a spa at this resort. We did not eat at the restaurant, but we did tour it. It was in the basement of the hotel, and it did not look or smell appetizing at all. The best restaurant we ate at was at the College of the Ozarks Teeter Center, which is a student-run lodge and restaurant that is excellent! Our favorite shows were the Duttons and George Dyer. Overall, we liked this timeshare. However, we would stay at the Marriott or Wyndham (both of which we've stayed at in Branson) when we go again. The Marriott and Wyndham have activities, and very nice, accommodating staff, who really try to make the guests' experiences happy ones. The Wellk staff just didn't seem to care one way or the other about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Some things good, others not.”
Reviews.Author: Grantminnie
Reviews.Content: We went to a reunion at the Welk Resort and stayed at the hotel. The pool areas were very nice and not busy. The water slide was fast and fun. The rooms were extremely basic, but well-tended. There is no refrigerator. There is a coffee maker with cups. However, I hesitate to use the cups, because I wonder how they're cleaned. There were no clean/dirty cups on the housekeeping cart. The bathroom was nice and big with great water pressure, but could have used better lighting. The staff was wonderful, helpful and attentive. The food at the restaurant was simply awful. I ordered shrimp scampi. I ate the shrimp, which was served atop a massive pile of plain spaghetti. I would agree that it's somewhat dated.

Reviews.Title: “nice - too far from shows”
Reviews.Author: judishia2
Reviews.Content: The show at the resort was very good, but in order to go to other shows you must drive. The rooms were clean and fine.

Reviews.Title: “okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous7171
Reviews.Content: The kids area at the pool was great and the bubbling on the ground did not seem to affect the kids playing there. The jets in the hot tub did not work and the minimum depth in the pool was 3' 6". My youngest child had to stay on the steps. I was expecting a shallower area for smaller children to play in. The rooms are very small. The beds are comfortable. The toilet was broke in our room and we had to only wait about 1/2 hour for someone to come and fix it. There is no vent in the bathroom so it gets pretty steamy in the hotel room when everyone is taking a shower. There was some mildew on the bathroom ceiling but otherwise the room was very clean. We ate breakfast and dinner at the onsite restaraunt and did not care for either. For the price this was a good hotel. Also know this is a timeshare facility and they will try to talk you into going on the time share tour any time you ask the concierge a question.

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Welk Resort. The hotel is a bit dated decor but everything seems pretty well maintained. The Splashpark was the highlight of hotel for the kids. The staff everywhere was tremendous, from the wait staff, to the front desk, to the staff overlooking the splash park. The rooms were nice and the beds were super. Very peaceful and quiet stay. Mini golf was a hit. Restaurant had great service and the food was good. Breakfast buffet was obviously the most popular meal and had a nice variety. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two 8 years olds enjoyed it until....”
Reviews.Author: beckerhouse
Reviews.Content: The bubbling on the pool area was NOT an issue for us. I didn't feel it was a problem at all. When I added the spashatorium and more to my hotel reservation I was told it would include the buffet breakfast, the water area, mini golf, and a free arcade room with lots of games. Well the buffet was average, the spashatorium was ok, nice slide, two hot tubs, NO diving area total depth was 5', the mini golf was NOT lit well for night play,(which the front desk staff told us it was). The arcade room was NOT free, the games required coins. Remember there is no fridge or microwave in rooms. The price for a motel room was good, but I would not recommend adding the breakfast and more---total rip off. Also my grandson began developing a rash, at first we thought perhaps it was from wearing a brand new tshirt that had not been laundered, however, after taking him to the Dr when we returned home, she informed us it was a bacteria infection from the hot tub. She did say 100 people could sit in the same hot tub and some would get the infection and some would not....think they need to check the chlorine levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: Swinnte
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small for families (we were crouded with 1 adult/3 kids) and the breakfast buffet wasn't very good. Aside from these issues, this was a great place to stay in Branson. The kids enjoyed both the Splashatorium and the pool behind the hotel (which we swam in twice with just us, which was nice). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but we'll stay elsewhere next time."”
Reviews.Author: raezr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the WELK. We did get a good price when we booked through the Branson tourism bureau. *There seemed to be lack of attention to detail ie... the bathroom appeared clean, but smelled like urine around the toilet & the shower curtain smelled musty when you were in the shower or bath. *The main reason we chose the Welk was because of the new Splashatorium indoor/outdoor water park. My husband & I were disappointed in it, because on the outdoor area, the rubber flooring was bubbling up in certain areas, which made it dangerous for the kids that were playing in the area. They even had orange cones around the bubbled up areas in the indoor part of the splashatorium. * The room was smaller than we imagined, & no refrigerator or microwave, which I should have looked up ahead of time :) * Lastly, the staff was nice & courteous, with one exception while I was waiting in line for the breakfast buffet. I was behind a younger girl waiting for syrup & as the girl left the line, a staff member with the last name of Chitwood, I believe,(she had a name tag on) came from behind us and stepped in front of me to get syrup.. Not a huge deal, but she was so busy talking it up with another guest about how nice everything at the Welk was, that she didn't mind her manners! :) And what is ironic, is that the whole reason I knew to come to trip advisor to rate the Welk, was because I heard her tell someone to come here & let them know what a "great time they were having and how the Welk was treating them" Overall, It was ok, but we will definitely go somewhere else next year :)

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place for a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lisaanneg
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson and our first time to stay at a Welk resort and we LOVED BOTH!!! Everyone at the Welk was so helpful during our week-long stay. The Splash-a-torium was a blast and we had fun cooling off almost every day we were there. We all agreed that the Welk Resort, Branson will definitely be a regular vacation stop for us - we've already started planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LisaPellham
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The only thing I would change is that I would put a microwave and fridge in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to be with Kids”
Reviews.Author: purplepanthar
Reviews.Content: I took my son for Spring Break and we had so much fun! Things get a little busy around check in time at 4pm, but we planned our time in the pool around that and didn't have to worry about any crowds! We went back again in June expecting it to be packed, but despite being busy again at certain times of the day, we never felt like there were too many people at the pool like a public pool feels like. We tried the Breakfast buffet at their restaurant and we didn't enjoy the food or the experience (they gave the away the lady's table who sat next to us).

Reviews.Title: “Top Pick in Branson but Beware of "Concierge/Timeshare" Staff”
Reviews.Author: RiverRunneth
Reviews.Content: Checked many of the sites and reviews for the Branson Area and except for some Table Rock Lodges this appeared to be one of the nicer resorts in Branson for the money. The hotel is nice, it has been remodeled but rooms are tight and some older features still remain.Thin walls!! The splashatorium (across from the hotel) was a nice feature. There is a small pool and free mini golf area outsode the hotel. Not really a waterpark but an enhanced swimming pool with a slide and activities going on much of the day. They need a bar/restaurant on site. They have wait staff at the pool but the restaurant is so far away it takes forever. They have a nice game room and workout area adjacent to the "timeshare" lodge. My biggest gripe is that the so-called concierge is really a timeshare sale rep and that is their major focus. At check in, the front desk sends you over to get your parking pass but in reality they are sending you over to get your sales pitch to go on a 2 hour tour and sales presentation for their time share units. Once we opted to pass on this, the "concierge" was less than accomodating and we decided to arrange all our shows on our own. We had breakfast one day at the on site restaurant and the buffet was good but would not want it every day. Other than the breakfast, the restaurant and bar was almost always empty.

Reviews.Title: “Splashatorim”
Reviews.Author: Paula2244
Reviews.Content: The splashatorium was completly awful! All the employees were very rude to me and my family. My children had a lot of trouble with the slide, they kept saying it sucks them back in, and there were no lifeguards,which to me was completly ridiculous for how big the place is. I did'nt feel comfortable leaving my kids alone at all. I had to constantly be with them,which left me with no time to relax. Also, my daughter got hit at the end of the slide by someone that went after her. There should really be a lifeguard or attendant at the top and bottom of the slide at all times. There were constantly kids running into each other at the bottom because they had no idea when to go and can't see at the bottom. Also the bathrooms were very messy. The stay I had at the hotel was fine. But I will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for Grandparents/grandkids”
Reviews.Author: paulak62
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this resort for families. Spent two nights with younger granddchildren. Kids loved the splashatorium, terrific after a hot day in Branson. Used the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. Good food and reasonable prices. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Room was clean and quiet. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Reunion Ever”
Reviews.Author: Judytraveler075
Reviews.Content: We hosted our family reunion at the resort. It had something for everyone. The children loved the splash-a-torium (some adults too). The staff was friendly and accommodating. Everything that was needed was on the property, including a complimentry hospitality suite. The staff made sure our ice chests were replenished daily. They also served over a hundred people at our Saturday get together(for a very reasonable price) which made it affordable for young and old alike. The room cost (again affordable ) included breakfast. Last but surely not least, I want to thank Cheri and Donna for helping me for almost a year, plan this event. I highly recommend this resort for a big event or just a family get away. Judy

Reviews.Title: “My children enjoyed it more than I did.”
Reviews.Author: TGG24
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and wonderful. We arrived on Friday, 6/24/11 and by Sunday I was already changing rooms for the second time. The first time was not the hotel's fault. There were three rooms jam packed with loud and obnoxious people/kids slamming doors and having a party in the hallway. At midnight I called the front desk when their kids were running wild up and down the halls, screaming and slamming doors, and they quickly worked to resolve the problem. If anyone is reading this, I understand you are on vacation, but HAVE SOME COMMON COURTESY FOR OTHER GUESTS LATE AT NIGHT! The rudeness of some people completely amazes me. That being said, the hotel's walls are paper thin. The carpet/padding NEEDS TO BE REPLACED. It is too old and outdated. This means if you are not on the 4th floor, it will sound like a stampede of elephants running over your head. The second room we were put in on the first floor had an infestation of flies. There were nearly 20 by the time we changed rooms again, after maintenance had killed a bunch and after we killed the first batch. By Sunday I had now unpacked a third time. I will say that the hotel staff was completely awesome in helping us. I cannot say enough about how polite and friendly they were; I never once had a problem with anyone I dealt with and had very pleasant encounters with them all. My children, who are 7 and 8, enjoyed the pool and water slide. Unless I was guaranteed a room on the 4th floor I don't think I could return and/or recommend this hotel. Also, half of the pillows are beyond lumpy - the other pillows were new. And when I say lumpy, I am talking lumpy, like they were run through a washing machine instead of being replaced.
