In fact, it's like they only replaced half of the pillows in the hotel, and having been in 3 different rooms in 3 days, I can attest to this. The buffet at the restaurant in the mornings was full of choices and the food was a great way to start the day. We ate at the restaurant for a couple of lunches and one dinner. It was very good. This hotel has great potential if they replace the remaining lumpy pillows and replace the carpet and padding to alleviate the obvious noise problem. It's also important to note that I traveled for over 5 years continuously so I am no stranger to "normal hotel noises" and do not need absolute silence to sleep, but this is above and beyond what you would expect as far as noise levels. All in all, my kids enjoyed it and would return in a heartbeat. I'm about 50/50 on whether I would return. The staff was positively wonderful, but the accommodations (noise levels) were too much.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! My kids and my husband loved it.”
Reviews.Author: lisaprince85
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the welk resort in branson mo. on june 19-21 2011. First of all i have to say I loved the water park.It kept my kids(ages 10, 9, 3) entertained the whole time. I was excited when i learned my daughter who is 3 was tall enough to ride the slide. We also went to silver dollar city while on our visit and all our kids could talk about was getting back to the pool at the hotel. The rooms were very modern. the only complaint I have about the room is the bathroom did not have an exaust fan ( not a good thing when u have two boys). The staff was great. the cost was about half the price of other waterpark resorts in branson. The waterpark isnt as big as the others in branson, but my kids didnt care. The hotel seemed to be staffed well. The walls are thin like other reviews have stated, but really wasnt a problem. The rooms do not have a fridge or a microwave...so bring a cooler. The hotel is off the strip so it was easier to get to where we wanted to go without hitting all the traffic. The resort also had alot of other things to do like play pool, laser tag, put-put,and other games. My boys and husband took advantage of all of the extras. All in all I think it was worth all of the money, and we will return soon. next time we will spend more time at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: TimC1984
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best resorts I have been to in Branson. The price was great for everything we got. The pool is huge with a large slide that the kids loved. Service was great, and the food was great at their restaurant. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive and ideal arrangement.”
Reviews.Author: joedecker
Reviews.Content: Our entire family lodged together. Great swimming and play areas for kids and easy morning walk over to the on-site breakfast. Close by all kinds of fun activities and things to do. Thanks Welk Resort for everything you do! See again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good as gold”
Reviews.Author: kjaros
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with thanks to a wonderful staff. Very gracious. Had a problem with our tickets and the team did a wonderful job of correcting the mistake quickly. You will just love the pool and all their services. Completely affordable too.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased and will return!”
Reviews.Author: kadester92
Reviews.Content: The Welk Resort in Branson Missouri was a very nice facility with great service, with a number of attractive features including the swimming/sliding facility on campus. We enjoyed our stay and hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to staying at the Welk in Branson every year.”
Reviews.Author: Dannyandcindy
Reviews.Content: The Welk Resort is on the outskirts of Branson. It has a gorgeous theater, perfectly suited for first-rate performances by the abundant musical talent in the area. The rooms are recently updated, and nice. The beds are very comfortable. And to top it all off, the staff at the resort are professional, helpful, and friendly. We attend a business conference at the Welk each spring, and enjoy the setting, the theater as a meeting room, and a quality room to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Average to poor...”
Reviews.Author: everythingprim
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel blind, we had never stayed here or even heard of any of our friends that had stayed here. I think that for the price, I didn't see the value. The pool was talked up to be something grand on there website and It really wasn't. There was a slide and a couple of splash toys... that was it. We stayed for six days and into about the 3rd night the toilet paper was gone off of one roll and almost gone off the other roll (they should have been replaced while we were gone). We went down to the desk and got another roll and hid it the next morning to see if the housekeepers would fill the empty rolls. Got back that night and they didn't fill them. Took them a couple of days to do it. I guess over all I just wasn't impressed and I wouldn't recommend this hotel. This was the first family vacation that we have ever taken and I paid really good money for us to stay here, took me nine years so save enough money to take my kids on this vacation. We have over night stays in other hotels for work that were $30 a night or less for us to stay and we taken care of much better I thought.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back next year”
Reviews.Author: loneyman
Reviews.Content: quick and courteous check in. Rooms and room service clean and efficient. Large TV, Coffee, etc, nice large bathrooms. Miniture golf course available free to guests, Great family pool and water recreation available with room if desired, (we did and loved it) I especially liked the fact that it is obviously a great place for families, as I saw a lot of families with children staying there. Lots of information about the attractions in Branson available there. Also our family really enjoyed the breakfast buffet each am.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penney!”
Reviews.Author: rdevans619
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Welk Resort as part of a family vacation to the Branson area. We chose Welk because of the indoor water park and the high reviews that we saw online, and we were not disappointed. From the very start of our stay we were impressed with the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. We did have some concerns because Welk is part of a timeshare program and we were afraid of some sort of high pressure sales pitch as part of our stay, but not once were we pressured or even bothered by any timeshare salesperson. In fact it was just the opposite. We were treated as a valued customer and granted the same FREE acess to all of the resort amenities ( including the indoor water park, miniature golf, air hockey, and billiards ) that the timeshare owners are entitled to! The only complaint that we had during the entire stay was the on-site restaurant. The food was average and the prices were a little on the pricey side but that is to be expected from a resort restaurant. All in all our stay was wonderful and we would recommend the Welk Resort to anyone visiting the Branson area.

Reviews.Title: “WELK SERVICE EXCELLENCE IS EXEMPLARY”
Reviews.Author: ERNIEK076
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Welk Resort. Enough said!!! Rooms are clean and well stocked with linen and soaps. Restaurant provides the perfect 'In house' food service so convenient for guests. Open area on one side of resort has miniature golf, kiddie services, swimming pool and lots of just plain space to walk around or sit. Unlike most hotels, you are NOT confined to the building and parking lot. Huge green area. Concierge service was impecable. We had six separate events. All tickets provided at the time of arrival with perfect arrangements. A real nice class of people staying at the Welk Resort makes for easy going relaxation and even conversation, if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: chadswife
Reviews.Content: Took the family on a quick get away to Branson. We really enjoyed the hotel. The staff was the best part. Very helpful and friendly. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun - horrible sleep!”
Reviews.Author: IV0513
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Welk Resort from May 5-11. We had a wonderful time at the Welk Resort and the Branson, MO area. The check-in process was very smooth and all of the staff were very friendly. The staff were very persisitant in wanting us to view the timeshares and still persisted even after we made it clear we were not interested. That did get a little aggrivating. Our son LOVED the Splashatorium. He was not tall enough to ride the slide but he loved the pool area and the outdoor pool area on the one day that it was open while we were there (it was too cold the other days). We booked a package deal and breakfast was included and was delicious every morning! This was refreshing since we woke up every morning exhausted even after sleeping all night. The beds were so uncomfortable that we tossed and turned all night. The only other negative was that the concierges were less than the best. They were not on time to help people any of the day's that we were there and could not give us much info about area attractions other than what was printed in the info materials that we could clearly read ourselves. While they could book anything we wanted, they were little help other than constantly trying to push us into viewing the timeshares. Overall we had a lot of fun and would return. Great value and location to all of the local attractions and ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay! Great water park, great beds! Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Handkerchiefgal
Reviews.Content: We went having no idea what to expect after reading the mixed reviews and were not disappointed...at all! The hotel was VERY nice! Clean rooms, not fancy, no fridge so we took an ice chest and that worked well. Ice machines where you can get to them. Also there were washer's and dryers (coin slot) that could be used by anyone. The water park was amazing! I don't know how you could go and not like this area! All of the outdoor stuff was closed due to the weather but the inside was amazing. It has an indoor and out door hot tub. And an outdoor play area with soft flooring. The inside area was amazing! Kids have to be 42 inches to ride slide and my 2 and 3 yr olds weren't able to ride but they got a kick out of watching their daddy slide down! We all enjoyed the hot tubs and the big pool...I'm sure it is even more fun when the outside area is open. The room walls don't seem very thick, that didn't bother me as much as the noise from the floor above...but it was fine. Parking wasn't very crowded so we had no problem finding a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Family centered resort with a caring and dedicated quality staff”
Reviews.Author: rrudloff01
Reviews.Content: This family centered resort has a fabulous indoor pool facility that will keep the young ones entertained until they tire out! From the pool staff, restaurant staff, front desk and concierge, you can be assured that they will do what ever they can to ensure that your visit to Branson is a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mswortwood
Reviews.Content: We've been going to the Welk Resort for many years with business associates. The Welk Resort is an awesome place for kids and families.We look forward to going there every year. The employees do an amazing job!

Reviews.Title: “USS WAHOO SS565 Reunion”
Reviews.Author: tank1955
Reviews.Content: Welk Resort Branson MO. We held our Submarine reunion at the Welk Resort on April 7-9 2011 It was perhaps one of the best we have ever had and I can say this as I have been in charge of all of them since 1993. Why do I say it? Well due to the outstanding service that we received at the hotel. The rooms, the hospitality room, and the banquet room were all kept in excellent condition. Cherie Chitwood and her staff are to be commended as anything I asked for was provided in a timely manner. The food and entertainment provided for our welcome aboard party was outstanding. The closing banquet food and service provided by Doug Phillips and is staff was exceptional. I’d also point out that the assistance Donna Rohrs provided with reservations was also excellent. Thus if you are going to Branson, give the Welk Resort a call, 800-808-9355

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CMend77
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay at Welk resort, it is very clean and they have very friendly staff. When we got there our church group was welcome in and made us feel at home. They had everything set up and ready for us. The kids enjoyed the indoor water park, minature golf, game room, and the play ground.. The breakfast buffett was wonderful and the food was great. I would recommend anyone to stay there. We will definately go back there to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay, not great, less than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: mommy_9500
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. We were on the third floor and it sounded like there was a herd of elephants upstairs all the time. Our neighbors were very noisy (knocking on doors, family meeting in the hallway, etc). The Stage Door Restaurant has an excellent breakfast buffet. The food was very good and the staff was excellent! They made us feel at home every morning. The cashier in the gift shop was very nice as well. We really enjoyed visiting with her. The clubhouse game room and exercise room were very nice and well equipped. Splashatorium was a full on MADHOUSE! People not watching their kids. Running and screaming. The water was freezing and the hot tub was packed. Not sure what was going on with the hot tub, people were getting out with foam all over them, as though they'd been in a bubble bath. I asked my daughter if she enjoyed the pool she said "no, I'd have rather been at the Grand Oaks, at least there I have room to actually swim." One evening I made her get out of the pool because a child was standing on the edge, coughing up nastiness, and spitting it into the pool and watching it drift to the bottom. It was one of the most disgusting things I had ever seen. I was absolutely shocked. We had no internet for two and a half days. When we'd call the front desk we were told they didn't know why there was no internet. Checked in on Wednesday and finally had internet about 7 p.m. on Friday. We had three laptops and two Ipods with no connection. The house computer on the first floor always had someone on it and while we were at the front desk with our computers they received two phone calls about the internet so we know it wasn't a problem on our end. After driving around town I realize we could have stayed elsewhere with an indoor pool, wifi, and breakfast for far less money. When things were brought to management attention the answer was "thanks for letting us know". Woke up on check out day to find a slip under our door, we'd already been charged for the full stay. Almost seemed as though they didn't want to know if you had concerns before you left. We had stayed at the Welk about eight years ago and this experience was completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Have been there several times”
Reviews.Author: RAM34
Reviews.Content: We have been there several times and always had great service. It is a nice place to stay and we always enjoy the food. I'm now 87 and hope I can come there again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing facilities, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Beaker18
Reviews.Content: Close to Silver Dollar City, wonderful indoor pool, slide, and hot tub, and a good restaurant all for under $100 a night. You can't beat this anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelnmoma
Reviews.Content: We met extended family at the Welk for Thanksgiving. We had a great time. We had a mix of ages -grandparents, my husband and I, our 19 year old daughter and her friend, and our 5 year old son. There was something for everyone. The pool, hot tub area is fantastic. There is also a free minigolf course, game room, and playground. We spent one evening playing games in the lodge commons area and had pizza delivered. There were several families in there. It was a really neat atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We asked for a remodeled room and got one. The beds were really comfortable -flat screen tvs, too! The walls are paper thin, so we had to turn on the fan in the room to block out the noise. Also make sure to put your do not disturb sign out if you want to sleep in. Housekeeping knocked on our door at 8:30AM one morning. We tried the breakfast buffet and it was very good. If you purchase it when you reserve your room, you get a discounted price. The cons: Not enough parking if you are there during a busy time of year (like Thanksgiving). Wi-fi was hit and miss No fan in the bathroom If you go out the back door, you can't get back in after 11PM -even with a key Thanksgiving Buffet was very disappointing for the price paid ($20 per adult)

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: pennic
Reviews.Content: We went for Homeschool Weekend at Silver Dollar City. The location was great. I was a little reluctant from other reviews. I found the beds were comfortable, the room was clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. My boys enjoyed the water slide but the pool was cold. The hot tub was great and you can see your kids in the pool from the hot tub. We went two nights to the rec center and enjoyed pool, and air hockey. The breakfast was included in our package. It was good basic eggs, grits, waffles, meats, ceral. We had the room service pizza special. The pizza, salad and bread sticks were great. I will stay here nexttime. My only dissappointments were the Ray Stevens Show and one of the conceirges. I brought my boys to the show expecting family entertainment. The first half of the show was a political rally. My kids were board and ask to leave. I had to explain some of the adult level comments to my children. Its a lot of money to listen to someone elses views. The lady at the concerige desk was short with people and only wanted to talk to folks buying tickets from her. The guy James was very nice. From the hotel their is a back way to Silver Dollar City that avoids the strip traffic. Danas Restaurant was just a mile down the road and we love eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money! Very Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: okiemom3
Reviews.Content: The website looked great but far from the truth. When we first arrived in our room the smell was terrible. Like wet moldy room. The air was on and it rattled and squeaked the entire time. Would only quit if you gave it a little kick. The parking was good at first then became a mess. The splashatorium my kids loved however it rained on Sat. when we were there and they closed it. The rooms are very dated and DIRTY. Im a clean freak but this room esp. the bathroom was pure filthy. It had not been cleaned in some time. Visisble dirt in the corners and filthy stains splashed all over. They never changed our sheets or cleaned the entire time we were there. Only replaced towels thats it. The same stains on the vanity never were cleaned. Spider webs in the windows. Oh and the bugs everyday we would come in and these small cricket like but would lined up against the wall. So gross. No vacuuming either the same pine needles etc were always there. Dont waste your money. Not worth it. No continental breakfast either. Boo!

Reviews.Title: “Pool area is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: crpics
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect, first time in Branson. Pleasantly surprised with the Welk Resort. Young teenage boys loved the pool area. Staff were extremely nice and even delivered food to the pool area for us. Rooms were ok, be sure and ask for the updated rooms. We were on 3rd floor and they were updated. On the surface they look nice, look a little closer and they still need some work. Tiles falling off in bathroom, no venting in bathroom. Walls are very thin, you will hear everything going on in hall and next door. Thought my son was drying his hair and then realized he was still in bed! Very thin walls. Only major cons to this place, and seriously MAJOR, the hot tub closes at 10 and the restaurant at 8!!!!!! We would go to evening show, come back and want some food, no luck. Or have a glass of wine and sit in the hot tub after show, no luck, closed. The only time we personally would have used the hot tub would be in the evening after a show, i.e. after 10. Kids get hungry watching tv at night, no room service, restaurant closed!!! Saying all that, I would recommend this place. I loved being off the main road and the pool area and staff make it great. Breakfast buffet was ok, no bananas that weren't covered in some red gel stuff though. Called it strawberry sauce, I never saw a strawberry in it. Also, the game room area was outstanding, and free! So I would say go, relax, and you will probably like this place!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't like the Welk”
Reviews.Author: travelgal143
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welk specifically to see a show there, planning to avoid the traffic after the show, and for that it was fine. We were very disappointed when we walked into our room, very outdated, dark and the beds were pitiful! I've seen better mattresses on a fold out couch. We could hear everything going on in the halls from our room, and could hear the maid vacuuming in the next room. The staff was friendly and the place was clean. At first we were disappointed in the "water park" but my daughter did manage to spend an entire afternoon there and the two hot tubs were wonderful. I can't imagine I would ever stay here again, if only for the beds and noise.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY, don't believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: bucksonly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Welk Resort (Sept 28-Oct 2, 2010), we were a little leary at first due to some of the reviews we saw on line. I'm not sure where these people stayed but it could not have been here, the staff was helpful but not over bearing, the rooms were clean and more than adequate, the beds provided a good nights' sleep, may be a little hard for some, but acceptable. Can't speak on the restaurant, because we never had an opportunity to visit, our 5 year old (including myself) loved the pool, she couldn't get enough of the water slide, the pool was never crowded. Upon arrival we ask if our room could be upgraded and they accommodated with a luxury king room, it was definitley bigger than the double queen and did not have paper thin walls as some have stated. It really is a great location, the strip is within easy access minus the traffic and Silver Dollar City is just up the road. Overall our stay was great and we will stay here again and highly recommend to others, thanks for the opportunity to leave a review.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, great waterpark for kids, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tos0922
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodges at the Welk resort and loved it. Great ambiance. The restaurant on site was a hidden gem, the food was delicious! The waterpark was a hit with the kids, visited it every night of our 7 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Welk Resort is okay”
Reviews.Author: trvlngal
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at check in. Beds were comfortable. Real coffee mugs with coffee pot in room. Bathroom is large. Lots of hot water in shower. Water pressure was good. Hot tubs were nice. Parking is limited. Bathroom smelled musty.Bathroom did not have an exhaust fan. Floors creak in hallway. Elevator groans. Walls were thin.

Reviews.Title: “Best family oriented water park/ resort money can buy. Grand...who? Castle...what?”
Reviews.Author: dlaw9737
Reviews.Content: Upon first contact I knew our stay was going to be positive. Our reservationist, Valerie was exemplary and above reproach with her rock solid positive attitude, even in the face of an assault of inquiries and delimmas presented on my part while making my reservations. I cannot say enough about her demeanor, it was calming, reassuring and confident. Upon arrival, accessing the the resort was a little tricky but manageable. The two individuals managing the check in area, Shane and Cainaan, was very attentive and polite to all guest even though there were was pressure from all sides for their services. Throughout my stay I would have to say that Cainaan was the epitome of exemplary "service with a smile." EVERY time that me or my family entered the lobby area and he was not busy with other guest, we were addressed by him and asked how our stay is going and is there anything we may need. This behavoir is definatley "above and beyond" the call of duty. The room was very clean and presentable. The staff presented a very good reflection of the resorts ethics and standards. The breakfast and resturant staff were phenominal. They assisted and supported the guest includung my family at every turn. We were not pushed or hurried along like other establishments. The resort and splashatorium was exactly what my family needed for a final weekend before the start of a new school year. The staff at the slpashatorium was very helpful and active with the guest needs. It was so nice to be catered to with the childrens events and room service while at the splashatorium eleminating the need to leave. This type of service allowed me and my family to truly "rest and enjoy our mini vacation". This resort is a very "Family" oriented establishment and it is evident in all aspects of it's operations.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: TTrom
Reviews.Content: As someone who has visited and stayed at Branson at least yearly due to the proximity to my home. ( a little over 3 hours away) I am way too familiar of the cons of Branson as my family has stayed on the strip and stayed in a local community of Rockaway Beach. I booked the Welk Resort through a Reserve Direct while purchasing a Silver Dollar City package for my family. I did this because the location is awesome. NO it is not on the "the strip" but it is so convenient to get to either the East or West side of Hwy 76 from this location. You don't get the noise like you do when you stay on the strip. I will take the scenic route of 10 minutes to avoid the 1 hour plus drive it takes to navigate up and down Hwy 76. After I booked I read several reviews on Trip Advisor and based on some negative reviews went with little expectations. So glad I went ahead and kept my booking. We were in town earlier than anticipated and was allowed to check in early. Very accomodating. Young lady at front desk was polite and helpful. Ask about being on the 1st Floor but was advised up front that we were on the 4th floor and would be more than happy to change that however 1st and 2nd floor were being renovated and noise may be a factor. I kept the 4th floor rooms as they were already renovated. I've read alot of reviews referring to "paper thin" walls. Honestly I couldn't hear anything going on outside my door with the exception of some children at ONE point who were excited about swimming and that was when I was close to the door. I don't blame hotel just excited children that may have gotten louder than usual. Rooms were not overly decorated with gaudy pictures and ridiculous bedspreads. In fact I have been on several cruises and the linens and bedding were exceptional quality and comparible. We had 2 rooms and guess what they were the same in both rooms. Rooms were cleaned daily. Fresh supply of towels and wash clothes. Mattresses were firm to my liking but not my husbands. Once again a matter of opinion. I do agree not queen size beds but then I didn't measure either. Wi fi worked instantly with no problem. Mini golf course was free along with game room with air hockey, pool table and foosball. NO quarters required. With children 12 and 7 years of age that is a blessing. No the mini golf isn't the 36 hole course that you pay an arm and a leg for on the strip but hey it suits its purpose and my sons took advantage of it not once but twice. Splash a torium! My sons loved it. No it's not Whitewater thank god! Kids loved the slide and they have been to several water parks and said it's the fastest they've been on. What a nice change from the game boys, Wii and playstations! If you go with out children there is also a nice pool on the other side of hotel that is peaceful but you will love the Splash a torium as well. On site restaurant. We had the breakfast buffet. Service was friendly. Buffet was quick and just that a breakfast buffet. Food was hot and fruit was FRESH. No extra charges for juices, teas or coffees. Go somewhere else and see if they don't add an additional $1.95 for your drinks. Not here. Sure wish we had tried the room service or dinner in the restaurant but never really had the chance. My husband visited the lounge a couple times during happy hour. $3 Margaritas were great and good sized and they didn't slight you on the alcohol either. Restaurant and Lounge do close at 8 pm. If you want a snack plenty of vending machines available and if you can't find what you want.. there is a Shell station maybe 1/4 north of resort that has a little of everything. We would go back and plan to. By far my best Branson experience and I have had several.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS ARE HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: hudnall
Reviews.Content: Walked into our room and was shocked at how dingy it was. Looks like a cheap motel room. Called front desk and complained and they said they would call us back. Never did. When up to desk and they said so what is so wrong with your room. It was definitely not like its advertised. Man at front desk said all their rooms are queen sized beds but they are not (others have mentioned this). They are only full size. Bedding is old. TV is like one I had about 30 years ago. Fixture around drain in tub was broken. Shower head old and discolored. We stayed there because we thought it would be a nice resort but rooms are horrible. We went ahead and stayed because we had already paid but would never stay there again. Lobby is nice and swimming pool is nice. Waitress in restaurant is extremely nice. Food is okay. Fitness center is a small room about 8x8 with one treadmill, one bike and one other machine. TV in that room is about 30 years old also and there is no fan. It's right next to laundry room and is extremely dark and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, terrible sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: BookGirlinMO
Reviews.Content: The rooms were surprisingly small, not as nice as we expected and the mattresses are AWFUL. They are NOT queen sized as advertised, and were like sleeping on a pile of bricks. Besides the awful bed quality, the constant noise from the halls made it even harder to sleep. The sleep quality is so bad here, we contemplated packing up and leaving in the middle of the night. Had the breakfast buffet once and wouldn't pay for it again. The concierge desk was useless; asking questions of the older woman that works there and all we got was "i don't know." We brought a cooler and had to lug it down 2 floors because the 4th floor ice machine was broke and they wouldn't fix it. The mini gulf course was in shambles, absolutely no maintenance. The ONLY upside to staying at the Welk was the splashatorium. Our kids loved it and we enjoyed it too. The waitresses are very helpful and friendly (unlike the Concierge desk.) To sum it up, this resort would be nothing without the waterplay area and is the only thing that does not need updating. Next time, we'll be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: poharrison
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. We held our parents 50th anv here and the staff was great from the house keeping to the resturant mgr and servers. The walls are a little thin and maybe put people checking in without children on the top floor overall we had a great time. P.S. If you are thinking about renting a boat DO NOT RENT FROM TABLE ROCK LAKE PONTOON RENTALS KIMBERLING CITY,MO The boat quit running after 1 hr and they would not answer the phone 3 hrs later we got this piece of junk back to the marina. The next day they told me they were not responsible and I would have the entire amount of the rental. When we pulled the swim ladder out the bolts were missing that hold it together.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, will come back!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleKM
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice. Very clean hotel, nice staff. Some updates would make the rooms nicer, but I would definitely come back. I was a little worried because of the Splashatorium, since I didn't have any kids, that I would feel out of place. Well, the Splashatorium is a seperate building from the hotel, so it seemed as if everyone was over there swimming, so the pool located right outside of the hotel was more for people without kids and it was pretty relaxing! The hotel isn't in the middle of town, so if you are wanting to just walk from your hotel, this isn't the place to go. But it is very peaceful where it is located and definitely worth the drive. I'm sure you won't mind, especially since you can pick up speed when you get away from the grid locked streets in the middle of town! One downfall would be the rooms/floors seem thin, I kept hearing kids running at night time. It could have been an ornery bunch we had during our stay, I'm not positive.

Reviews.Title: “Lawrence would be proud!”
Reviews.Author: kdm52
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package deal for $1,037.00 which included 5 nights, a choice of 5 shows, buffet breakfast each morning and $20.00 off for a dinner at the restaurant. The price above also included the upgrade to a king size bed/bigger room. The salad/breakfast buffet at the restaurant was great! We did have a lunch/dinner at the hotel however it wasn't very good. I enjoyed the restaurant staff; very friendly! The hotel does have a lounge, however, I thought the prices were a little expensive even at happy hour (3 to 7). This hotel is a great place for children. They have activities for the kids, which include a water park, pools, miniature golf, etc. For the price we paid I thought we got a great deal. A few last notes: The traffic is horrible. Get the Ozark Entertainment Guide. This is a one page guide that shows all of the shows on one side and alternate routes (red, yellow, blue) to get around the Branson area. Definitely check out the tram ride at Dogwood Canyon in Lampe, Missouri (about 30 minutes away). It is a 2 hour ride and costs $25.00 per person. The park is beautiful and includes a visit with buffalo, elk, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Splashtastic time at Welk Resort”
Reviews.Author: luv2teach1st
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our 2nd stay at the Welk Resort. Since our last visit, they have added the Splashatorium which is a huge indoor/outdoor pool with slide & splash pad. It is a wonderful addition. Both my children (ages 4 & 7) said the pool was their favorite part of the vacation. Hotel staff was very friendly, great location away from the hustle & bustle of 76, rooms are average & are being updated, and pool-side food service was great. Also, we had no problems with the WiFi service. It worked great from our room the entire time. We will definitely being staying here on all our summer Branson visits.

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard beds, filled with flies, no internet and loads of mold!”
Reviews.Author: BOFH88
Reviews.Content: Each day we had to kill about 4-5 flies in the bathroom. I know it was not isolated to my room since one night I tried sleeping in a chair in the lobby to escape the 30 year old beds and I was swarmed with flies in the lobby area on the 1st floor. I am guessing that the flies are a result of whatever horrible thing happened in room 112. When I asked about this room the only answer I got was "all I know is that it is out of order". That was an understatement. I peaked in the room (the door was not locked and was slightly cracked open), and saw a completely gutted room with wet towels, water and flies everywhere. The "watery substance" began oozing into the halls and by our last day there, you could smell mold. I would think that a cleaning crew or carpet dryers should have been in place to prevent this awful mess from getting worst, but there was no cleanup effort for the 5 nights that we were there. When a hotel says "Free Wireless Internet", one assumes this means in their room. I only saw the Welk SSID one time on my laptop from my room and the connection was too poor to connect. I am guessing I was not alone since every afternoon, every chair in the lobby was occupied with other guests and their laptops. The guest computer setup in the 1st floor lobby had a 1Ghz CPU and 512MB of memory and was so slow it was worthless. Upon checkout, I made the reception staff aware of these issues. Her response was "Did you enjoy the Splash-a-Torium?" My response was "Yes, it was nice, however the main reason for staying at a hotel was to have a place to sleep each night and this was miserable." Her response was, "We are remodeling and if you come back next year it will be better". So, obviously, her efforts at an apology or to make it right fell very short. The only positive was the splash a torium. However, I would have had a better deal, and a more comfortable overall experience if I stayed at a $50 / night flea bag on the hwy 76 strip and just got tickets to the water park.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mouldon
Reviews.Content: Wife and I took our six year old grand-daughter to Branson and we chose the Welk Resort for two reasons - positive reviews on TA and Splashatorium. We were not disappointed. Like some have pointed out, the basic rooms are a bit dated, BUT, our room was clean as a pin, had comfy mattresses and the AC was cold. The staff was great and our grand-daughter thought the pools and splashatorium were the greatest. She must have gone down that water slide a hundred times. Breakfast buffet was nice and we liked the quiet location and layout of the resort. Only suggestion we would have is that they could use their own snack bar or convenience store, since the restaurant closes at 8 PM and there is not much around the immediate area in the way of stores or restaurants. Overall, a great time. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent - Rooms need updating badly”
Reviews.Author: MalibuSearcy
Reviews.Content: You can not ask for better staff. Friendliest you'll find anywhere. But, that's where the good stops. Rooms need updated badly. My wife and I were there for our anniversary and when we walked into the room she said, 'Oh, this is not good'. That set the mood for the rest of the time. Therefore, we cut our trip short. The woman at the counter was very gracious and gave me my money back for the time we didn't stay. Again, I can't say enough about the staff and their friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flybaby2004
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very helpful & nice.The rooms were nice & clean. The water park was a lot of fun. The mini golf could use some work. It was kinda run down. The hotel was very nice overall. We had a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: germ539
Reviews.Content: We stayed there June 1 - 4 at the AAA rate of $72. The new splashatorium is very nice, my son loved it. The room was nice, two queen beds. The only complaint that I would have on the room is that there was no "exhaust fan" in the bathroom. They had what might have been a return air vent in the bath room but no visiable exhaust fan. No continental breakfast but they do have a restaurant that has buffets. I overheard someone talking about the breakfast buffet and how it wasn't too good. It was worth the money, it's off the strip about a couple of miles but worth it. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money for the quality of rooms..Splashatorium was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: TScat2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welk "Resort" over Memorial Day weekend. We usually stay at Marriots or Hiltons and figure this would be comparable for the money we spent. The rooms are definatley not worth the nightly price you pay, but probably average for Branson. Definately not "Resort" quality. The Splashatorium made up a little for the rooms lackings. The only knock I have on the Splashatorium is that the 100 ft slide closes at 9 pm, while the rest of the very large pool closes at 10 pm. The kids loved the swimming. Its almost like the pool section doesn't go with the Hotel...Clearly renovated rooms with heavily plastered walls painted a depressing brown color. Mini golf course is very small and needs work. Even the bronze statue of Lawrence Welk included a broken baton! The Breakfast was pretty good, but this costs extra..$8.95 for adults. Overall I say its about a 3 out of 5 stars to me. I am reccommending this "Resort" but dont expect anything fancy about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find.. friendly staff/not well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hip-hip-shiraz
Reviews.Content: We went over Memorial day weekend. Mapquest had us end at the police station Downtown Branson from there we called the hotel and after an hour and 2 phone calls back to the hotel we finally found it.... It's outside of Branson. We checked in about 10:30 and were tired... the staff was friendly, but it is hard to make up for the "OK" room with the freakingly loud AC unit that you could not keep the fan to the "on" position. We were woken up about every 30-40 min. with the AC turning on. I probably would not stay here again. For the quality I would have just picked something average on the main Hwy thru town. At least you'll get a free breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but pool a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aumommie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok hotel rooms. It is an older hotel but the rooms were nice. You could hear people that were loud in the hall ways but this didn't seem to be much of a problem. The free puttputt course needs a little work but was fun for our 7 yo. The "water park" was a bit of a disappointment.It is more like a pool with a water slide and play area. It was much smaller than expected. While we had fun there and it was what it was. I don't know if it would keep teens occupied for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnyChevyEG
Reviews.Content: We took our family here for a Branson vacation. We have two small children, and they loved the pool areas. That was about it as far as kid friendly activities. The hotel was a little bit too far from the main part of the town, so we were stuck in traffic a lot. We will most likely pick a hotel closer to town next time. We did try to add an extra day to the trip but were told we would have to switch rooms as the computer already assigned our room to someone else. I do not understand how they couldn't just assign the other room to the people who were coming in the following day. Other than that, this was a great hotel for those that want something secluded.

Reviews.Title: “Please update the sheets and comforters!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxin777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average. The staff was courteous. The common areas were fine and the Splashatorium (sp?) was great, but the room was poor. The sheets were so old and worn that there were little knots all over the fabric. I ended up sleeping in my clothes.

Reviews.Title: “stuffy air in room, no ventilation”
Reviews.Author: jh911w
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and grounds very well manicured. The room was nice but stuffy, you could smell stale air.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy experience”
Reviews.Author: arkjohn
Reviews.Content: Room was very noisy. You can hear people going up and down the hallways as well doors slamming and people talking. Finally quited down around 11:00 pm. The quiet was replaced the first night by a drunk tying towels together and tying them to doors across from each other followed by banging on the door. Front desk did send security promptly to deal with the situation. Was interrupted again around 1 am and 2 am by what sounded like security dealing with the situation again. The individual checked out the next morning, so elected to stay the second night. Could still hear everyone up and down the hall though. Just looked at bank account and got billed a second time for the room 5 days after we checked out. Called to find out why and they said I would have to leave a voice mail for a return call since they had no one in accounting. Awaiting a return call tomorrow. They did offer a third night free to offset the noise, but we had to leave. Waterpark was nice, but not sure it is worth the hassle. Would have to pay extra for the lodges if I were to consider visiting again. Not sure I would want to though. Only gave them a try because the kids wanted somewhere with an indoor waterpark. One more odd thing. The television was tied into the hall light. Had to have the hall light on all the time to get the television to power up.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for indoor fun or sleep...”
Reviews.Author: FSTRMAMA
Reviews.Content: Although the resort was clean and well maintained and the staff friendly and helpful... we chose this resort for the 10,000 sq ft indoor water park and free game arcade they advertised. We traveled with kids and would need to keep them entertained. The water park was a small pool with a slide, a small water toy that was boring for kids over 4 but too big for kids under 4 and a hot tub. the game room was a pool table a foose ball and an air hockey game. Needless to say our rainy day wa not very fun for the kids and we ended up going out to find fun. The beds were uncomfortable as well as the bedding. The motel was obviously wood frame built as we could hear every step that was taken above and below us. it was not a restful nor enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Timmah001
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Welk Resort over Halloween and I was extremely impressed at the service and quality for the price we paid. All the staff was very helpful and the rooms suited our needs. The new indoor pool area was alot of fun and I can not think of any complaints. It is about 5-10 minutes off the strip depending on what stop lights you hit, but that was not a big deal for us. I would stay again for sure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Reunion”
Reviews.Author: CindyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The new water park area was particularly nice. The rooms are fine, nothing fancy but all needs are met. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Tracey1223
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend there and the rooms was a little small but extremely clean and nicely decorated. The beds were nice and we didn't hear any noise from any of the other guest. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The resort was off the strip but this was great. We were out of all the traffic and used the back roads. We can't wait to go back and stay again. Would highly recommend this resort. Great for couples and families. Lots for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort for families!”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the brand new (opened April 2009) lodges. The hotel is older and we didn't see the rooms, but I can tell you that the lodges were fantastic. We stayed in a one bedroom that had a living room with tv and dvd player, full kitchen, full bath with jet tub, washer and dryer, master bedroom with balcony and tv as well. The resort has a wonderful playground and miniture golf area that is free. The resort also has an indoor/outdoor waterpark that is also included in your stay. The weather was in the upper 70's and the water was heated. I absolutely HATE to swim in cold water and this water was fine. Overall it was wonderful except for the early check-out of 10:00 am!

Reviews.Title: “The Lodges are better than the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aubieboiler
Reviews.Content: We were there August 8-15 amd had a condo/suite at the Timber Ridge Lodges. These were VERY WELL DONE. Our one bedroom unit had the half-kitchen. Very nice, comfortable bed and the hide-a-bed was fine for the boys. The water area was great. The day the person mentioned it was closed - he didn't tell the whole story. It was closed from 3-7 for a private party and was supposed to reopen until midnight for guests. However, thunderstorms were in the area and the have a (correct) policy to not open the pool until 30 minutes after lightning has moved out of the area. This didn't happen until way past 10 pm. I can understand why people would be disappointed with the hotel. The hotel part did seem to need some updating, but I also see how they are trying to change the concept. The hotel and theater were originally there because the Welks were famous. Many of the people who watched Lawrence Welk are gone. The future of this property is in the Lodges, attracting extended stay families who may consider buying into the resort. I liked the location because it wasn't right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Taj Mahal !!”
Reviews.Author: jsmarti
Reviews.Content: The resort seemed to bend over backwards for visitors. As I was told as a young man, if you watch and listen...you will learn. Most of the people I heard and spoke with seemed to be satisfied with the resort. The only negative comment I encountered was "Parents letting their kids run the hall" especially at night! My Grandson and I were busy the entire time we stayed at the hotel. If you find the hotel boring then you're not doing something right. We stayed 4 days and would go back in a hearbeat. I was glad to get home for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “timeshare at the lodge”
Reviews.Author: rbjjm211
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare 13 months in advance for the new lodges at Welk resort. First, let me say that the lodges are beautiful and we had plenty of room. We had a 2 BR/2 BA unit that was around 1400 sq ft. The problem I had if you get a lodge condo, get a 2nd floor unit. We requested a 2nd floor 13 months in advance and again 2 weeks before we arrived. Once we arrived and check-in, all they had was a lower unit. Unit was great, the other guests above us were not. The sound coming through the upper units was bad. From the first night we had banging and running noises from 11:30 PM - 1:00 AM to start again when they woke up at 7:00 AM. Never got any sleep the whole week. Called front dest after 2 nights and they said they would take care of it. Never happened. Went back down to request to be moved to a upper unit to be told, do not have any. After the week was ruined we went to the front dest on our last night to find out what can be done for us and was told we could get a hotel room there for $99.00/night. I about fell over with this response. I then wrote a letter the next morning to the GM and front desk manager and dropped it off at 9:00 am and we never heard from them at all. That to me is very unprofessional and lack of respect to a guest. The new pool is great but the hotel itself needs to be updated. The lodges are in a great location for Branson and if we did not have to deal with very rude people above us the whole week and if management would of helped us out, I feel the stay could of been good but the way it "was not handled" gave me a different opinion, especially after they said we could get a room for $99/night. How rude was that. If you can get a upper unit, I feel you will have a enjoyable stay, if not hope you get a non-family or a quiet group above you because the noise does come through.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money...depending on your room”
Reviews.Author: hll0211
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Had problems at first...first room was 2 queen beds (we booked a queen), 2nd room felt VERY humid and the carpet was wet, 3rd room was great! We were happy after that with the room! Our big issue was that the internet was down the entire time we were there. I kept asking about it and they said they were working on it. The internet wouldn't really even work on my cell phone. We usually look up and book everything on the internet, but couldn't here. VERY frustrating!!! Pool area was AWESOME! My husband and I are in our mid-late 20s and WE loved it. The water slide was much more than we had hoped for. GREAT! Another thing is that there is not a free continental breakfast but there is a restaraunt on site. BUT, a plus, there was free parking. We would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Let the Truth BE KNOWN - BEWARE of the WELK RESORT Hotel, MO”
Reviews.Author: BOBBY00
Reviews.Content: The welk hotel needs improvement! The service staff needs to be retrained on how to resolve an issue-problem. WE HAD A VERY POOR EXPERIENCE: 1. The rooms are very dirty. FYI: Housekeeping does not clean rooms properly. 2. NO HOT water, and bathtub drain was clogged. 3 Front desk manager was away for weekend, and NO ONE was "acting as" a manager. 4 Numerous calls were placed to front desk, and nothing was done to resolve the problems. FYI: They seemed to have a blind eye to the problems and stated I was the first guest EVER to complain about the water.................................FYI: READ THE OTHER REVIEWS!!!!! ( I made the miskate not to before AAA booked this) 5 WE left early and found another place to stay. The location and amenities needs a complete make over............FYI: the splash zone is the olny thing current. I can not say I liked anything about this hotel. They use the "timeshares" to appear inviting on the web-site, BUT it's completely separate from the Hotel. Oh, The fact the staff is not caring is because they are numb to ALL the complaints they recieve on a daily basis. (this is my opinion) - I hope this helps???/

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving Pictures”
Reviews.Author: firewomancher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welk Resort and just got home today (08-13-09). Our stay was from Aug. 10th to Aug. 13th. I booked our stay there due to the pictures that were posted on their site and the package deal. I called a few days ahead to request a lower level room and to have a refridgerator placed in our room. I was told that they did not assign rooms until the day of our arrival and that they would have a refridgerator placed in the room we were assigned to. Well, when we arrived...we were put on the top floor and no refridgerator was in the room! Then to top it all off...the internet service was down the entire time we were there. And our room was sooooo small. I could not believe how small it was compared to how the pictures on the site make them look so big. Same with the swimming pools (inside and out). They were smaller than what the site made them look...will not recommend to anyone and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbeq
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of the hotel--a lot of negative ones and was sceptical to say the least when booking my reservation. I found the hotel to be a GREAT place!!! Service was wonderful and the kids LOVED the new Splash-a-torium Waterpark. Room was a standard 2 queen bed with ample space and much larger sink areas than normal standard queens. There was free miniature golf for hotel guests which my kids enjoyed. I loved the easy access to Silver Dollar City-acces was by 265 which avoids the 76 traffic. Book this resort. You will not be sorry!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the lodges”
Reviews.Author: travelorfromtx
Reviews.Content: The lodge condo was fabulous. It was equipped with 4-5 star hotel amenities (granite countertops, down bedding, pillowtop mattress, etc..). The kids loved the Splashatorium. The 9 hole mini golf course needed some serious work. We called twice for sheets for our roll away couch and were never sent them. Check in time was a late 4 PM and check out time is an early 10 AM which seemed standard for Branson establishments, but still not good times for people traveling with small children. I would only reccommend the lodges to others.

Reviews.Title: “Kids LOVED the Splash-a-torium!”
Reviews.Author: okiemomof2
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Welk, and we mostly enjoyed our stay. We felt the rooms were pretty standard as far as size goes. The beds were not the most comfortable and the pillows were flat. We stayed on the fourth floor and the water pressure was great , and hot water was plentiful. Our kids loved the splashatorium, and we spent three afternoons there swimming and relaxing in the hot tubs. The kids also enjoyed the game room in the clubhouse. My husband enjoyed the fitness center and appreciated the natural beauty surrounding the hotel in his morning jog. I felt the location was okay. It was a short distance from the strip though, so we didn't feel like we were in the middle of the action. Overall, the best part of the stay was the splashatorium and clubhouse amenities. The actual room was standard, and we could have had a similar room on the strip for a lower price. The breakfast buffet was definitely sub par, especially for the price. I would not recommend eating in the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Branson, but we wer disapointed in the welk resort”
Reviews.Author: 484dixie
Reviews.Content: We loved Branson and the kids loved the splash-atorium, but we did not get the rooms we booked we were outraged.We were supposed to have joing rooms but instead we got small rooms that werent con-joined, and the rooms that we were supposed to have they gave to someone else!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back there...”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl73860
Reviews.Content: Not a very happening hotel at all....found it to have a very boring atmosphere..would not suggest it for children at all-all though the pool area for the kids was not bad but it just lacked atmosphere...we ate in the large restaurant which was nothing but a glorified cafeteria-lousy food-lousy hours but the waitress was very friendly. Bar area was set too far away from the hotel and there was absolutely nothing there that said Lawrence Welk not unless you happened to see the statue of him out front that had a broken baton which was replaced with a plastic straw..pitiful to say the least. The rooms were clean-but they were just standard rooms nothing special to say the least. The putt putt golf was pitiful..dirty and not very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Welk”
Reviews.Author: KCGRAYS
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Welk Resort - Branson. We found the resort comfortable and "familycentric." Our room was cool and clean with lots of extra pillows (our request)! My kids really enjoyed the new indoor/outdoor waterpark and game room. The service was friendy and fast and they were good with recommendations on what not to miss in Branson. The location was also a great too - off the strip (the ony way to do Branson) and close to everything. Sincerely, The Gray Family, Kansas City

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL GOOD BUT NOT RESTAURANT”
Reviews.Author: babycakes12
Reviews.Content: My parents,daughter and myself were at the hotel for mothers day weekend. The hotel staff(most of them), accomdations and cleaniness were up to my standards. However the Stage Door Restaurant was not worth the 7.99 price (hotel voucher) that we had to pay for cold overcooked eggs, overcooked and undercooked bacon and not enough variety for the price. I would recommend thishotel to my friends and family traveling to Branson but would suggest that they go elsewhere to eat their meals. I would also like to suggest to the hotel that they offer some type of continential breakfast to their guest like alot of the other resorts and hotel in the area do. I would stay at the hotel again if i ever had a reason to travel back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite 3 Star Hotel, But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ljloribelle
Reviews.Content: I was very uneasy about staying at the Hotel after reading all the negative reviews. We booked through Hotwire so we did not know where we were staying until we were booked. The Hotel was very clean and did not have any bad smell. The beds were fine and the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was Friendly. We stayed during the winter so did not get to see all the outside activities that are available. We had plenty of ice in the ice machine and easy access to vending machines. The hotel had fresh Krispy Creme donuts for breakfast. I would stay here again but would not make it my first choice. ljloribelle

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was awful”
Reviews.Author: sassy_sally
Reviews.Content: The hotel was worn out and dirty. The staff was indifferent. The buffet at the Stage Door Restaurant was horrible and not worth the money. The "fitness room" was a joke - it had 3 cardio machines from the late 1980s. Felt more like a cheap motel than a "resort." I advise you to spend your money elsewhere. The ONLY good thing about this place - the Rankin Brothers. These guys put on a really great show at the Welk Resort Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vacationplanner51
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from our 5th stay at the Welk Resort in Branson. As always we had a wonderful stay. The staff was fantastic. Our room was clean and everything worked fine. We found the gift shop open a lot of hours and shopped there 3 different days and times.The Welk Reunion show was great as it is every year. We ate on the property 3 times and liked the food and staff. We really appreciate how well the hotel is run and the positive way they take care of their guests.Mom is already looking forward to the next trip. Five trips to Branson ALWAYS the WELK!

Reviews.Title: “Not Picky”
Reviews.Author: GramD31
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 40th wedding anniversary trip to Welk Resort in Branson, MO. I'm not picky so I can truthly say - it was fine. Both of us noted the carpet needed cleaning in the entire facility. Worse than home with 4 kids around! Staff was very friendly and we encountered no one guests/staff disgruntled. We did utilize the Stagedoor for convenience - not worth it. If we had not had the $30 coupon for dinner we would have been very disappointed when we received the bill - the price of 2 only avg buffets (no menu available) tea and a too thin marguerita was MORE than a wonderful meal at Olive Garden and the most fantastic marguerita the evening before. Again, for convenience we went back for breakfast and inquired on the price before sitting and the waiter said he wasn't sure but he "thought" it was 9.95 - for breakfast-not me! We went up the road and had a great breakfast buffet for 4.99. Convenience is not worth double the money for less quality food. We went to the Welk Family Reunion at the theatre and it was absolutely awesome! We will go back in another 40 years!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: familyclan
Reviews.Content: My family (mother, 14 year old son, 16 year old son & his 16 year old best friend since age 1) and I loved the Welk Resort. It was a beautiful hotel with a pool, hot tub, and 9 hole mini golf course. It was off the main strip where it was quiet and serene, yet still close to all of the theme parks and chaos of the strip activities and shows. After running around all day it was nice to come back to a clean, quiet hotel where we could swim, play mini golf and spend quality time with the family. The hotel was friendly, helpful, and most accomodating to our needs. I will most definitely be taking my family back to the Welk Resort for our next visit. The only thing we wished we had was a mini refrigerator to keep milk and other cold items in; however, that certainly won't stop us from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Main hotel shabby; new lodge condos nice”
Reviews.Author: zilphap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new lodge in a one bedroom condo in the Pine Lodge. The condo is beautiful and well equipped. The kitchen is fully equipped, and has a full size refrig/freezer. I'd recommend stopping at a grocery store for at LEAST your breakfast meals, so you don't have to go down to the hotel restaurant in the morning. I had asked for a room that is handicapped accessible. We were on the first floor. (It is two floors, and I didn't see an elevator) There was no handicapped parking with flat curbs by our building. There was at another one of the new buildings. Our lodge is part of a new timeshare resort that is still being built. Luckily, my husband is not 100% wheelchair bound. It would be difficult getting in and out of the bed, the toilet, and the bath tub, which is a jacuzzi (nice if not disabled) is tough to get in and out of without help. We stayed in the one bedroom, which is over 800 sq feet. VERY nice. The porch is private and has two adarondike type wooden rockers. It overlooks a pond. The new pool/water park is not open. This was disappointing. The hotel pool is about the size of a backyard pool, and is outside the main hotel. There is a 9 hole mini-golf course that is older and nothing special. It would be fun if you had small kids. There is no additional charge to use it. If you are diabled, you need to take a car down to the main hotel. The main hotel is shabby looking. The carpeting is dirty and older. It smells smokey/not pleasant. The gift shop is only open during the morning and when they have dinner shows. The restaurant looks like a cafeteria. The lounge smells smokey, even in the morning. The staff is very friendly and nice. Ramsey, the consierge was SUPER in helping us choose our shows, get our tickets, and help with handicapped patron issues. The resort is located a few miles from the main drag. This is not necessarily bad. In summary, if you stay here, stay in the condos.. If you want do be near the action, I would recommend the Hilton at Branson Landing.

HotelInfo.Name: Welk Resort Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 1984 State Highway 165, Branson, MO 65616
